column1: back of a length, no lateral movement to speak of, tapped to cover to get off the mark straightaway
good delivery, outside off stump, tight line, left well alone. And there's some encouraging carry on offer too. Bairstow gathers with an exaggerated give of the hands
back of a length, tapped back to the bowler
swing this time, but way down the leg side.
tempting delivery in the channel outside off, ghosting away from the left-hander
this one nibbles back into the left-hander. Interesting first impressions. Some bounce, some movement... but not a whole lot just yet
tight line, full length, tailing into the right-hander, squirted to cover
decent carry on a wider line outside off, a comfortable leave
on the back foot, blocked to the off side
stands tall in defence to poke to the off side
hits the seam as he rolls his fingers on the ball and nibbles the ball back into a defensive block
defended into the off side, standing tall to meet another bail-trimming length
a bit of outswing to the left-hander on a wide line, Warner lines it up and lets it go
leg-stump line, bending to off, defended on the back foot. That was more conventional lateral movement
good ball, perfect length, swinging, and hitting the seam for extra zip off the deck. But Warner is equal to it, leaving alone outside off
too short this time, and thumped square. Warner doesn't miss out on those! A crashing cut, and a fast outfield takes it to the rope
on the back foot, Anderson a touch too short to make his swing count. Warner dabs to point
good length, wide line, no stroke offered
too wide to draw a stroke, but a very solid line, hitting the deck outside off, seeking to lure Bancroft into an indiscretion
good patience, waiting for the ball that nips back into the body, and tucking it square
full length, ghosting in, a compact drive to cover
round the wicket, good line, angled into the left-hander. Warner showing excellent judgement outside off stump

tremendous leave! That was pure judgement and awareness of the off stump, as Broad brought the ball back in towards the stumps, but Warner just ushered it through with no qualms. Beating the top of off by a whisker
hitting the seam, attacking the top of off
another good leave on length, Bancroft lining it up well
a dramatic delivery, as the ball jags off the seam and past Bancroft's edge. But Anderson is a yard too short to challenge the edge
through to the keeper once again, Anderson's length still too short for his liking
that's more like it from Anderson, right up to the toes, threatening to swing but holding its line to be defended in front of off
wider on the crease, very full length, and that's impressive running, an insta-call as the ball was dabbed to midwicket
very full, driven hard and Broad tumbles in his followthrough to prevent at least three runs
outside off, hitting the deck hard, Bancroft leaves alone
tapped to cover, another sharp run
round the wicket, vertical bat, pushed back down the pitch
angled into the pads this time, Warner has been impressively compact this morning, waiting for the ball to come to him, as it does on this occasion
outside off, through to the keeper with rather less carry than some so far today
tight defence, standing tall on the back foot to repel all threats
drawn onto the front foot this time, very solid defence as Anderson finds a fuller length
shorter and sharper, just something for Bancroft to think about
defended on the back foot, Anderson veering on the short side once again
fuller this time, but a closed-faced clip down to backward square
worked square off the back foot again
that's a more threatening length. Very full, bending through the air, defended on the line of off. Well played, but that's a rare delivery that was headed for the stumps
nudged off the hip
a hint of outswing as Warner shoulders arms
well bowled this time, but another tremendous leave from Warner. Entirely on length, trusting the carry and letting the ball pass over the top of off
too short and leg-sided, jabbed off the hip and scampers back for two. Sharp running
too short once more, and tucked into the leg side
forward and pushed to cover
stabbed out to point as Anderson angles across his bows
good line and length, but Warner is so composed outside off. Just not interested
ooh, there we go. This is a fraction fuller, and swinging away again, but Warner is this time tempted to have a flirt. Better from Anderson
good again, from bowler and batsman. Full and swinging, but composed and leaving
dangling it out there, but Warner is in command of this battle
left alone outside off, a touch of outswing, and no stroke offered
outside off, through to the keeper once more
banged in short, no stroke offered
back of a length, nudged to gully
too short once again, as Bancroft slides into line outside off to stab into the gully
good-looking delivery, tight line and beats the edge. But again, too short to really threaten
back of a length, firmly punched into the covers. Too short again...
good outswing, but too wide to lure the well-set Warner
up on the toes, punched to the off side
better line and length, fuller and tighter. But another solid leave
pushed across the left-hander, no stroke once again
good carry through to the keeper, but Warner leaves on length like a boss, over the top of middle and that's another threat-free over negotiated
outside off, no stroke once again
on the pads, and worked to backward square
fullish, wide of the stumps and left alone
pitched up in the channel, no lateral movement for Woakes and Warner unceremoniously blooters a drive through the covers for four
touch shorter, 138kph and zipping through outside off as Warner drops back
back of a length, tapped down towards backward point, where Vince's misfield allows them to scamper through for another single
round the wicket, nicely bowled, Warner decides to leave quite late and it clips the bat before bouncing towards slip
more good running from these two, dabbing on into the covers
over the wicket to Bancroft, good length and shaping away as the batsman leaves
length ball, tapped down towards cover, Overton is the man to swoop... but his underarm throw balloons over the stumps with Bancroft stretching for his ground
round the wicket again, 132kph on a length outside off, Warner opens the face and steers to point
pitched up, angled in and clipped firmly by Warner, picks out mid-on
Woakes hits a length, again it refuses to budge off the straight, tip and run into the covers for one
back of a length, tucked away off the thigh pad
fuller, in the channel and stunned towards mid-off coming forwards
good carry, but it's erring on the short and wide side again, no need for Bancroft to play
fuller on off, Bancroft pushes back to the bowler
line and length in the channel, left alone by Bancroft
tight lines, fractionally short outside off, Warner shoudlers arms
fired in straighter, blocked to the leg side. That might have hit the stumps...

pitched up, Warner blocks into the covers, where Moeen misfields... but Bancroft has been left stranded and a direct hit from Woakes does for him! Oh calamity! England have their breakthrough and it's come via a run-out! Bancroft was keen but ignored the old adage, Warner sent him back responded to the call before changing his mind and selling his partner a dummy - leaving Woakes plenty of time to steady himself and hit one-and-a-half stumps
full, some curl back in, Warner is rapped on the pads and Broad is immediately into a celebrappeal.. but that was missing leg, Aleem Dar rightly not interested
another good ball, this teases its way past the outside edge as Warner pushes forward
good length, holding its line on off, shows it a straight bat
starts a touch short on the hips and Khawaja works it away to get off the mark and off strike
length on the stumps, tapped away
full, in the channel, Warner looks to flay it through the coves but mistimes it to the fielder
bit of extra bounce, shaping back in and Warner takes a blow on the body
that's a decent line, fullish and wobbling outside off, well left in the end
pitched up, again Warner shuffles into line and draws his bat away
pitched up, gets him coming forwards, Khawaja steers it along the ground through point for a couple
on the stumps, turned to the leg side
touch back of a length, seaming a little as Khawaja gets into line and blocks
comes across and works a length ball down to the leg side
in the channel, length ball tapped away
good length, just outside off, better discipline from Broad here, geed up by the wicket (albeit not off his bowling), and Khawaja defends
angled across from over the wicket, Warner defends on off
lovely delivery, on that either-or length, has him feeling for it... but passes the edge
length on off stump, jabbed into the covers
sliding through outside off, still a fraction short
fuller length, Warner comes forward and punches for one, clear shout of 'No!' as Khawaja turns this time
woof, that's a nipper, drags Khawaja across and curves past the bat, Anderson throws back his head in frustration
full and tailing in, comes off the pad and runs behind square as Warner attempts to glance
shortish, 137kph around off stump, Khawaja defends watchfully
good ball, good leave, pitched up and straightening a few inches outside off, Khawaja plants the foot and shoulders arms
bit of shape again, Khawaja tries to close the face and turn to leg, gets a low leading edge
Broad is bowling over the wicket to the left-hander now, defended
back over the wicket, pitched up and left alone in the channel
good length from Anderson, hits the seam and squares Warner up a touch, but he was deep in the crease and plays it softly off the outside edge for a couple through gully
sliding across on a good length, allows this one through
Anderson is probing away on a length around off, this time Warner blocks
tight lines, defended into the off side... still a fraction short, I'd say
pitched up, not a half-volley but Warner is into it, brings out his steak knife and stabs four on the up through the covers - Anderson will love that
goes short on the body now, tucked through square leg
full on off, Warner hops back and flings his hands through a quicksilver drive, not out of the middle and Woakes gives chase from mid-off
over the wicket to Khawaja, good length and curling in, left alone comfortably enough
in the channel, 132kph and climbing through to the keeper as the batsman comes forward and leaves
banged in short, the bouncer doesn't get up all that much and Khawaja pulls wide of fine leg for a couple - and that's the Australia 50 up
length on off, exaggerated forward defensive from Khawaja
fuller, 134kph in the channel, mistimed on the drive towards mid-off
good length on off, 128kph to start with, defended from the crease
ooh, past the top edge, extra bounce as Warner wafts off the back foot and is beaten
good carry, he's a tall man and will get bounce, 131kph and this one is allowed through
dug in shorter, Warner plays his favoured leg-side flip, in the air for a while but bouncing safely short of the fielder in the deep
nibbling away in the corridor outside, staying over the wicket, left alone
oof, rising sharply off a length again, Khawaja does well to drop his hands underneath the ball
round the wicket, touch short outside off, lets it go
fuller and veering in, Warner closes the face and works to the leg side
good length outside off, Warner makes room to try and drive but doesn't get any timing
in the channel, seams a touch and Warner slashes wildly at it but fails to connect! Broad holds his head in his hands
comes across to defend a length ball. 'Wait on!'
accurate stuff from Broad, 136kph and aiming for the top of off, defended into the covers... Good battle going on now, both sides with the bit between their teeth
full, 130kph outside off, very floaty and Khawaja latches on to a drive, picks out extra cover
good length, wide of the stumps and this time the batsman leaves it be
good line, 133kph and nibbling away from a slightly fuller length, again watched closely and left by Uzzie
shorter, rising through outside off as the batsman leaves
short from Overton, he's in position quickly and Khawaja swivels to dispatch it in front of deep square leg for his first boundary
straight up-and-down in the channel, no stroke offered
round the wicket, pushed through on off, Warner taps it away on the back foot
tight lines, defended on off stump
pushed through quickly on off stump, defended again
flighted, this spins and bounces, hits the outside edge but doesn't carry as far as slip
flatter and worked away to backward square leg
Moeen floats this up and Warner defends off the inside half of the bat coming forwards - maiden to begin with for Moeen
full in the channel and driven, the outfield is a little heavy from the rain and they settle for three
tighter on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
comes forward and shows it a straight bat
lets this one go outside off, bounces low through to the keeper
short and pulled, in the air for a while amid shouts of 'catch!' but it lands fine of deep backward square and bounces away to the rope
length ball outside off, comes across to block
fired in on middle and off, defended
tight stuff from Moeen, waits in the crease and blocks
tossed up and pushed into the off side
pushed through on the stumps and Warner again plays it circumspectly
Warner uses the feet and whips against the spin, manages to get it past midwicket for a single
floated up, allows it to grip and straighten, lines this one up okay on the front foot
short ball from Overton, goes for the ramp but it looked like a late decision and Warner fails to connect
length, touch too straight, worked off the pads
exploring the boulevard of broken dreams outside off, Khawaja isn't interested in going for a stroll through
good length, nipping away and clipping the outside edge, runs along the round to backward point
yowzer, that's well bowled for no reward, sharp away movement from a good length, beats Khawaja's outside edge as he fiddles at it
angled across and this one is left alone
floated up, Warner punches to deep point for one
spin, bouncing up outside off, Khawaja taps it away on the back foot
uses the feet, doesn't quite get to the pitch and the ball comes off the toe of the bat, bobbling back towards the bowler
comes forward again, this slides in the pads and Moeen belts out an lbw appeal... but he'd got quite a long way down and Dar would have been guessing
tossed up on off and defended solidly
flighted, Khawaja comes forward and blocks again
full and larruped through the covers, Warner gets reward for lots of diligent blocking by crunching the half-volley
short now, width for Warner to throw his hands at, carved up and over gully and there's no protection to prevent back-to-back fours
round the wicket, rides the bounce and steers one through cover point
short of a length on the stumps, tucked down off the pads and they scamper through
back round the wicket to Warner, 131kph and defended on the front foot
pitched up, tempting him with one in the channel, Warner keeps his trigger-finger in check
flighted, gives Khawaja the chance to dance down, it's a bit of a toe-end chip over mid-off but he gets enough of it and picks up two

ooh er, what's this madness...! Full toss from Moeen, which Khawaja manages to bottom edge on to his front pad, the ball then looping behind short leg to safety! That would have rivalled Chris Rogers' dismissal to Graeme Swann at Lord's in 2013
short now and lashed through square, gets it away with some power and picks up four
tossed up and prodded away on the back foot
pushed through outside off, cut again, straight to the fielder... but it goes straight through him and runs away for another boundary! The nuts on England's wheel bolts are loosening again
flighted on off stump, comes forward and smothers it
over the wicket, fired across the bows, steered through the off side for one
hits the pitch hard, 138kph and discomfiting Uzzie, hits the shoulder of the bat but he keeps it down towards backward point
in the channel outside off and left alone
good length, the pink pill already looking a bit sickly, gun-barrel straight through to the keeper
pitched up outside off, 138kph and blocked into the covers
touch short of a length, whizzing through outside off, again no need to play
on a good line and length, stabbed back down the pitch
chopped out to point, signs of extra bounce
squared up on leg stump, offering no room to free his arms
back of a length, good leap off the deck from Moeen, but a controlled punch out through point
round the wicket, drawn forward to defend
good finish to the over, a middle-and-leg line, attacking the stumps, and duly defended
edged and gone! There it is, England's first bowler wicket for 83.1 overs! Outside off, nibbled off the seam, Warner had a flirt, and Bairstow did the rest!
on the pads, Smith flicks to leg, Khawaja wants the single and is sent back! Safely home in the end, but a bit dicey!
banged in short, as Smith stepped across his stumps pre-emptively
well, that's how to get off the mark! Leaning onto the front foot, presenting a blade as wide as a bulldozer, and pile-driving a boundary through the covers
outside off, through to the keeper as Smith leaves well alone
wide of off stump, climbing through to the keeper
an inside-out drive, through square leg. They all count, even if his pads were briefly in peril there
way outside off, inviting Smith to have a chase
outside off, nibbling back into the right-hander, nudged to leg
outside off, Smith leaves alone with a twitchy flick of the bat, and invites a brief conversation from Broad as a consequence
another leave, another chirp. Come and have a go if you think you're hard enough, seems to be Broad's message
wrong line from Broad, too straight, and too easy to tuck off the hip to backward square
another extravagant leave, bat finishing horizontal like some samurai sword flourish. It's just plain odd to be frank, but by God it's effective!
takes a fat outside edge, squirts to gully. Never a catch
thumped hard back down the ground, a tumbling stop at mid-on
banged in short, too wide to tempt a stroke
smashed into the covers, but can't beat the field. This has stepped up a notch, and no mistake!
short and sharp, Khawaja ducks
clipped back towards the bowler as Khawaja hangs back in his crease
a crashing pull, nicely timed and played, but Moeen at deep square is well placed to intercept
outside off, no stroke offered
solidly behind the line, for all Smith's twitches and tics, he is never less than perfectly still at point of contact
oh, well bowled. Tight line on off stump, hits the seam and takes the edge, but low into the gully
oh dear, that's a leg-stump pie. A half-volley on the pads, and gratefully flicked round the corner
outside off, and through to the keeper
defended on the back foot, attacking the stumps
nudged into the gully, with an angled bat
short and hauled round the corner
Squared up in defence again, but good solid contact in the end,  back down the pitch
outside off, through to the keeper
held back a touch, strikes the pads as Khawaja leans forward from the crease, but pitched outside leg
good delivery, tight line outside off, through to the keeper
swing, and fenced down through the gully, to bring up the 100. Not a bad delivery, but more runs chalked up for Khawaja, who has had an attitude transplant in this innings
good delivery again, wide on the crease, coming into Smith all the time, and ghosting past his edge with a bit of seam and bounce
onto the back foot, jabbed down into the crease
a touch of width and that's a wristy crunch on the back foot. Beats the diving cover. Top shot
jabbed down into the pitch outside off
too short, and that is utterly slammed through midwicket! Some rank deliveries sneaking into Woakes' repertoire in this spell, but Khawaja has put them away superbly!
fully forward, dabbed to cover

banged in short, it's a top-edged pull but it's been dropped by Stoneman at deep backward square! That's a terrible miss, had to make some ground, but his hands were like concrete when the ball thudded into them...
spanked through the covers to add insult to injury. What a critical moment that could prove to be!
on a good length, defended into the off side
drawn onto the front foot, punched to mid-off with a straight bat
tapped to the leg side, Anderson gives chase but midwicket does the gathering
on the back foot, riding the bounce and outswing, and tapped to cover
extra nip off a good length as Khawaja wears this one in the midriff. Squelch
nudged to the leg side
squirted into the gully
good delivery, angling back in and keeping a touch low as Smith hops forward to defend
Overton is interested in this one ...! Smith wanders across his crease and is struck reasonably adjacent. But the height saves him. Close though!
well bowled again, almost a cutter, as it jags back and keeps low on off stump
a loose drive from Smith who is reaching onto the front foot and is never quite there. Nor is Overton, who stretches in his followthrough but can't reach the ball on the full
banged in short. Ducked
driven on the up, very full, and Smith inside-edges through the leg side. This is a good little passage of pressure from England
back of a length, cramped on the leg stump, tapped back to the bowler
up on the toes, stabbed to cover
nudged back to the bowler
outside off from round the wicket, left alone
jags back into the pads from round the wicket. Anderson wants it, but that was too much guesswork for the umpire. Good finish to the over
a rolly-wristed drive to cover. Reaching for that awkward length again
back of a length, defended resolutely to mid-on
well bowled again, attacking the top of off, Smith is trying to manipulate a gap but can't work the angle
tucked off the face of the bat to midwicket
a crushing drive! And that's what Smith can do, soak up the pressure and then put it away when the over-pitch is served up
on the legs, worked to midwicket
wide of the crease, very full, attacking the stumps, threatening ...
back of a length, Smith rides the bounce to guide a controlled edge through third man
clipped off the hip, and another single is chalked up
inside-edged into the pads as Anderson finds the right length but can't force a way through
well bowled again, as this one bursts off the seam. Smith leaves, but perhaps not as casually as he had intended
another inside-edge, no short leg, though it was travelling too briskly to have been a genuine chance. Still, he's toiling hard for his team
good turn from outside off, tucked round the corner
down the track, a wafty flick into the leg side, beats the diving short cover
round the wicket, looped up and blocked on the crease
back of a length, slashed hard through third man, in the air for a while but always safe, and that is his fifty! Well played that man, a battling knock, and a lot more positive than at Brisbane
drilled off the back foot to short cover
well bowled, albeit a fraction short. But the line was good and Khawaja blocks on the back foot
very full length, angled into the legs
tight line on off stump, Smith attempts a clip to leg
well bowled again, another cutter, as Smith waits on the front foot for the ball to arrive
on the pads, wrong line this time, easy pickings through square leg
tapped to leg
very full, attacking the base of middle, nudged to mid-on
round the wicket, looped into the blockhole, punched to cover
back over the wicket, Smith advances, then plays a cute dink to leg, minimal risk, for a single to mid-on
on the money to the left-hander, blocked
'very good' is the call from behind the stumps as Moeen loops one onto Khawaja's bootstraps
forward and blocked to cover
back of a length, tucked to leg
on the legs, worked to the man at short square leg
firm defence, back down the line of the ball
short, too short. Ignored
on the back foot, clipped to the leg side
worked off the pads to square leg
turned into the leg side as Overton strays too straight
leaning onto the front foot, stabbed defence
pushed back into the crease, decent turn and bounce from a full length
tossed up, and blocked with a big stride, Khawaja playing for the break
back of a length, flicked to square leg
well bowled again, fizzed a bit flatter into the blockhole, and defended
on the pads, whipped to leg to end the over
extra zip down the leg-side, Khawaja tries  a flick and nearly gloves it to Bairstow
short, ducked
on the back foot, blocked to the on side
short and that's fairly sharp. Khawaja elects to bail out of any shot and ducks well at the last minute
good aggression as Khawaja lets the ball hit his thigh pad
that's a very good bouncer to finish the session, round the wicket and gets big on the batsman as he turns his head inside the line
slightly back of a length over off stump, 125kph loosener which is tucked away through backward square leg for one
length, rising outside off, Khawaja taps it down on the off side
hits the pads, Anderson appeals but that was leg side

gottim, flashed to gully! The break does the trick for England again, Anderson has a wicket, Khawaja has given them an opening... Pitched up in the channel and he was never in control of the drive, Vince took a smart catch flying to his left
touch short of a length and defended to leg on the back foot
whoosh, this snorts off a length, rising through past the bat as Handscomb feels for it outside off
length ball around off, Smith guards his stumps
in the channel, slightly short and Smith swats it away square for a couple, not supremely timed
tighter to the stumps, not tempting enough to make Smith drive this time
good length, comes across and pushes wide of mid-off and they scamper one
length ball a foot or so outside off, Handscomb is setting up camp on the back foot, leaves
rising in the corridor, again he's able to judge the line and leave alone
Anderson still dropping a little short, left alone outside off
probing lines, 130kph in the corridor of he's-got-to-nick-one-eventually, Smith defends
fullish on off, Smith stuns it into the covers
back of a length outside off, Smith stays deep and scalps a couple more past cover
length, rising up on off, Smith crabs across and works the ball away to deep backward square
yammering away around off, Handscomb is able to block stoutly off the back foot
fullish on off, 137kph from Broad, bunted back towards mid-on
good length, possibly a cutter from Broad, blocked back towards the bowler... Smith seems to feel he should have done more with that
back of a length, climbing sharply in the channel, no stroke offered
Smith again shuffles across and leaves a back-of-a-length ball
on the stumps and worked away through backward square for one more
testing line from Broad but played softly by the batsman, angles a thick edge down through the cordon for a couple to get off the mark
woof, that's jack-knifed away, slightly short and Handscomb stays back and plays inside the line
straighter and worked off the legs
pitched up a littler fuller, punched through midwicket as Smith's bottom hand takes over

rapped on the pads, Smith playing no shot... Gaffaney shakes his head to Anderson's beseeching appeal! Definitely hit outside off and I don't think that was coming back anywhere near enough. England sensible not to review
fired in full and tapped away
aiming for the top of off, this looked for a moment like it was snaking into the pads only for Smith to whip it away for a couple more
pitched up, beats the outside edge! There seems to be a bit more zip off the surface under lights, Handscomb driving without foot movement
finds the edge again but this flies through the slips for four more! Again Handscomb did well to keep it down
fired in on off stump, defended
good length, Handscomb lines up a block
goes full and straight, worked safely into the leg side
Handscomb shuffles across and turns the ball to leg, Anderson scampers after it, having negotiated his way past Smith again... There's some enormous niggle developing in this series
good length on off, pushed into the covers
pitched up and he attempts a push drive, comes off the inside half of the bat
gets into line on off and taps towards cover
bit of extra bounce this time, comes back in and hits Smith on the body
short and climbing outside off, straight-batted back down the track in defence
on the stumps, tapped back to leg and Anderson deflects it with an outstretched arm
Handscomb comes across to defend on the back foot
Broad sticks to that fourth-stump line, again blocked from the crease
fuller, Handscomb drives crisply but can't get it through the covers
ooh, another good nut, sidling in and then straightening brusquely past the outside edge
banged in short, slightly leg side as Handscomb ignores it
short of a length, 135kph and Handscomb gets in behind it, blocking to mid-off
shortish and slapped off the back foot though point for a couple more
back of a length again, Smith cracks a drive that perhaps should have brought him four... but finds cover
fuller, comes across to defend on off
nicely bowled, Smith knows it too... He fixes Anderson with a grin and holds the pose. Full and straightening just a touch on off, turns him around to find the leading edge
good length, comes across and prods towards mid-off
ducks out of the line of a bouncer to finish
pitched up on off, Handscomb is deep in the crease and drives to mid-off
good length, nothing given away by Broad, blocked into the off side
short and defended on the back foot in front of off stump
over the stumps, 135kph but still a little short and he tucks it defensively to leg from back in the crease
drops in the bouncer, Handscomb pulls and there's a sound on the way through... but England's appeal is only half-hearted and there's no appetite to review
on the stumps and defended again
in the channel, comes across and leaves
full outside off and clubbed straight to extra cover, Smith misses out
good length around off stump, tapped back watchfully
fourth-stump line, 136kph and steered in front of backward point for one
shorter, rising outside off, Handscomb opens the face and touch and pushes square
tailing in, on a length but he's happy to stay back to those and continue blocking

bowled 'im, Smith plays on! THIS IS NOT A DRILL!! Overton has his maiden Test wicket and it's a yuge one... England's plan to bore Smith out bears fruit, attempting to block yet another length ball outside off, it maybe nibbled back a touch, there was a gap between bat and pad, and the ball sneaked through to nudge Smudge's timbers
pitched up and steered into the covers for a quick single
touch too straight, Handscomb clips off his legs but finds the fielder
length ball, comes across his stumps
short of a length, at the body and helped around the corner
round the wicket to Marsh, unleashes a bumper that sails through over the batsman's head
Woakes plugs away on a good length, prodded away
Handscomb hangs back and defends
fired in full and straight... he's a whisker away from being lbw but manages to skim away at the very last moment and gets four to fine leg. Played it well
length ball on the stumps, Handscomb is completely squared up trying to play across his pads again, this hits the leading edge and runs into the off side
around fourth stump, rising from a length, blocked
length ball on off, Handscomb gets into line
angled in from round the wicket and turned to leg
Overton sticks the chin music on the gramophone, Marsh has to jerk his head out of the way
length ball, lets this one go outside off
fuller, dipping in on the stumps, Marsh jabs it away to the on side
in the channel, touch short, no need to play at it
short and sliding down the leg side this time
on the stumps and turned down into the leg side
targeting the pads again, this strays just a touch too leg side and Handscomb flicks it away fine for four more
fullish on the pads, Handscomb plays this like a startled cat... but keeps the ball out effectively
length ball on off, pushed away
full, outside off and Handscomb is driving, deep in the crease and he slices it towards point
speared in straight, tucked to the leg side
good length, shaping in and Marsh is struck on the pads, looked to be heading down with the angle from round the wicket
touch shorter, left alone in the channel
pitched up, gets him pushing forwards, hits the inside edge and runs behind square for one
steered in the air wide of the slips! Overton gets something out of the pitch once again, rising sharply and it got big on Handscomb as he tried to cut, just flew beyond the catching cordon
slower ball this time, outside off and left alone
back of a length and tapped defensively to leg
Woakes goes over the wicket to the southpaw, pitched up and prodded into the covers
good length, 137kph and challenging the edge as Marsh's bat scissors down in defence, the ball runs square
bangs in the bouncer, Marsh rides the bounce and swivels a pull in front of deep square, where Moeen gives chase
props forward to defend on off stump
oi vey, nearly another drag on... Just a touch of nip back in as Marsh aims an expansive drive and he almost comes a cropper, the ball deflecting into his front pad
pitched up and shaping in, left alone outside off
dug in short, Handscomb is across and defends it safely down earthwards
turned away from off the body
full, coming in from wide of the stumps, 132kph and Marsh leaves it alone
pitched up and defended back towards mid-on
short ball, veering down the leg side as Marsh gets his furniture out of the way
dug in, decent bouncer, awkward angle but Marsh rides it well
full length, angled into the pads
squeezed out into the leg side, a bit of a half-volley really, but Handscomb is so crease-bound he can't make much capital of it
pushed from the crease once more, into the off side
on the back foot, extra zip in that delivery. Defended with a straight blade
defended on the back foot
open-faced glide into the gully
on the back foot, round the wicket, keeping it real for Marsh as he defends
wider outside off, left alone
full and angled into the off stump, met with a strong straight bat
over the wicket this time
banged in short, and Marsh latches onto this one magnificently. Into position early, rolls the wrists, clean through midwicket
cut firmly, but straight to point. A pair of loose deliveries towards the end of a fine effort from Overton

speared down the leg side with a cluster of close fielder and that was technically a chance though Stoneman at short leg would have needed the hands of a ninja. And we've already established that's not the case
clubbed into the off side
looking to flick to leg
leaning out of the crease, an attempted nurdle on a leg-stump line
forward well, dabbing into the covers
driven airily, into the covers
on the legs, flicked fine
short and wide, but he gets away with it as point gathers
solidly behind the line to defend
driven into the covers, full attacking length
squared up by a full-length delivery - squirts off a leading edge to point
round the wicket, solid line and length, stoutly blocked
twirled onto the toes, and flicked round the corner
clipped through midwicket, solid contact as Moeen strays in line a touch
held back in the flight this time, bites a touch as Handscomb defends on the back foot
dances out of the crease to meet this one, and driven sweetly to cover
solid stride forward, blocked into the off side
tossed up and driven, Moeen sticks out a mitt to prevent the single
back of a length, as Overton's valiant spell continues. Defended back down the track
on the pads, flicked to leg
banged in short, Marsh ducks
tight line from round the wicket, clipped to short leg
worked off the hip to square leg
another over negotiated
round the wicket, and that's off-line, sliding past the leg stump, almost on the full. An old-school loosener
better line and length, round the wicket and keeping Marsh honest

flicked supremely off the pads, that went like Ravi's tracer bullet, but that's also a supreme attempt to save the boundary from Overton at square leg. Slid full-length but his forearm was touching the rope as he hauled it back in
tighter line
banged in short, Marsh ducks
sweetly struck, right in the arc, and lambasted back whence it came with a vertical bat and lovely timing. Intercepted on the rope
good length to launch his spell, pushed compactly to cover to bring up the 200
width, and cracked firmly through third man. Top shot, right in his slot. He's so far back on his stumps, that anything short is too short
on the back foot, blocked to cover
tight to off stump, wobbling back in towards the stumps. Blocked
opens the face as Anderson finds a bit of lift on off stump, gathered in the gully
sliding across the crease to defend on the back foot
back of a length, down the leg-side, deflected off the glove behind square
good length on a fifth-stump line. Left alone
banging it out there, trying to tempt a late mistake
well bowled, fuller and floatier, and threatening the edge of a tightly honed defensive technique
a bit too loose this time, on the toes and flicked fine
banged in short, and Handscomb has an unthinking swish off his eyebrows. No contact, but that was a bit closer than he intended
through to the keeper
good leave outside off stump, excellent judgement
a round-house leave, keeping the bat out of harm's way, as if passing it over a flooded ravine
forward and blocked
good leave once again, Anderson keeps tempting in that channel

gosh, what happened there? Looked for all the world as though he'd patted up to a straight one, but I think that deflected off a half-committed bat. Anderson looks suitably non-plussed, but then he usually does, the big grumpus
outside off, no stroke offered
nibble dibble! This one just bites the surface and seams back into Handscomb's pads. Going over, but something to ponder...
leaning forward, a half-cocked defensive push to short leg
another nibbler, climbing past the off stump on a tight line. Good ball, good defensive judgement
targetting the stumps this time, and Handscomb makes sure he gets bat in front of his twitchy pads
full and straight, demanding a stroke, but Handscomb is again equal to it on this occasion, blocking it to the leg side
very full and defended outside off stump
big swing on this occasion, but from outside off and heading wider
big, big movement with the new ball, but Marsh lines it up and leaves it well
the inswinger to the left-hander this time. Clever bowling, but negotiated with aplomb. And a cheeky single to square leg too
outside off, too wide to throw a bat at that one
good effort to finish from Anderson, a big booming inswinger, but it does too much and whizzes down the leg side, to be clipped to square leg
back of a length, kisses the surfaces and skips through as Handscomb sits back and plays inside it
nip-backer from Broad, touch short and it raps the thigh, caught on the crease but high

pitched up, whirring in like an angry wasp off the pitch - and that's bang in front! England strike in the first over of the morning afternoon, Broad on the money and Handscomb once again nailed lbw deep in his crease... Perfect ball to a batsman trying to restart, hit on the back knee in front of off. Handscomb wisely decides not to review
pitched up and worked through midwicket off the inside half of the bat to get going
ooh, juicy stuff, superb length and he draws Marsh out, bowling from round the wicket and then shaping it away
touch short and sliding down the leg side. Good first over from Broad, though
length and swerving away, takes the outside edge but Paine manages to squirt this through gully for a couple
half-tracker down the leg side, not particularly edifying from Anderson, slugged to fine leg for four now. Paine bringing the pain
touch short, defended on off stump
length ball, comes across and lines it up
Anderson gets this in the right area, short of a length and spitting as Paine moves across and then jerks out of the way
fired in and then holding its line, Paine taps it down square off the outer half of the bat
good pace, 136kph on off stump, Marsh comes across and blocks
beats the bat, there's a sound on its way through... Bairstow and Root are keen behind the stumps, Dar less so in front of them. Flicked the pocket
pitched up, Marsh pushes back along the carpet towards the bowler
full, gets him driving, struck firmly but Moeen Ali, fielding at short straight mid-on, snaps it up on the bounce
length outside off and nipping away a fraction as the batsman leaves
full and straight, drifting on to the pads and Marsh skelps it firmly through midwicket for his first boundary of the day
lovely delivery from Anderson, seaming the ball away as Paine feels for it, maybe just a fraction short
short and thumped! Sweetly struck, rocking back after an initial move forward and he gets four over midwicket with a business-like whack
on a length, starting quite wide and then moving further away
angled in and defended on off
targeting the stumps, Paine covers it solidly in defence
pitched up but this is a wide half-volley and Paine thrashes it over gully, he's getting stuck into Jimmy right now!
overpitched by Broad now, swung early but Marsh was forward and gets over it, sending the ball screaming away square of the wicket for four more
good length, 139kph on off stump, dabbed down softly in front of point and they hurry through
nicely bowled, good length and holding its line, beats the bat
shorter, angled in and rising to hit the thigh pad as Paine works across the line
pitched up, 138kph but sliding to leg and Paine clips one firmly to the man in the deep
round the wicket, pitched up on off, blocked back towards mid-off
good length outside off, hint of away swing and left alone
pushed in straighter and Paine defends
angled in with the arm, 125kph to start off with, defended from the crease
length on the stumps and worked to the leg side for one
round the wicket, there's that Overton bounce and it hits the shoulder of the bat before looping well short of backward point
goes a touch straighter and its worked to the on side
touch full on off stump, Paine looks to come forward again but can't get into a drive
speared into the pads, struck on the protective gear but that was heading down leg
slightly back of a length, steered towards point
gliding in and puts it on a rail outside off, left alone
dug in short, Paine sways out of the way
length, already the pink ball becoming harder to shift sideways, Paine gets on to the front foot and carefully pushes into a gap at cover for one
pitched up and Paine continues to play his shots, driven down the ground, briefly in the air but wide of the bowler in his follow through and it skitters away for another boundary
back of a length, quite wide and left alone
banged in and Paine was walking across, takes the blow on the backside
fuller, defended in front of the stumps
hammers the middle of the pitch, extra grunt in Overton's bouncer, 133kph and it flies over the ducking Paine
good length on off and Paine shows it a straight bat
over the wicket, hitting a length and pushing it across the lefty, who leaves
Anderson still a touch short, no need to play at it

fuller, this comes back, raps him on the knee roll - and given! Marsh reviews but this looks hopeful, it landed on the stumps and straightened... but Hawk-Eye has it bouncing over the stumps! Brilliant review and Marsh survives! Marsh was well forward and that ball seemed to leap off a full length. More frustration for Anderson
back of a length in the corridor and left alone
short again, flying through outside off as Marsh drops his hands
goes fuller and straighter but this time he gets back behind it in defence
length in the channel, medium pace with a touch of outswing, nothing doing
straighter line, Paine defends
full on off stump and well covered as he comes across
Paine works a single off the stumps
round the wicket, short outside off and left alone
comes across and blocks a shortish-length ball into th eoff side
length on the stumps, Paine works a single square
pitched up on off, Marsh pushes a drive short of mid-off and judges a scampered single well
in the channel and lets this go

beats the bat on the inside and up goes the finger again! Paine immediately reviews and height could be an issue again... Yes, it struck him on the back leg, actually on the thigh pad, definitely clearing the poles
another huge lbw appeal... but Gaffaney isn't giving this one! England look distraught, Root considers the review - but it's a good job they didn't, as there was a thick chunk of bat on it! Crikey
sliding in with the arm, Paine pushes at it and thick-edges one to leg
good length outside off, left alone
smacked on the pads again! Overton likes it, Aleem Dar not interested... Think that was high, too. Spanked on the thigh again, clearing leg stump according to ball-tracking
angled in and dabbed down the leg side
comes across to defend a fullish ball on off
back of a length, climbing briskly as Paine works it away to leg for a couple
too straight and again flicked off the hips for a single to fine leg
short of a length, a couple of feet outside off, no stroke
ooh, that's a beaut, full and then jagging past Paine's groping push forward, like a man feeling for a light switch in the dark
goes back and across and steers the ball down towards gully, who dives to cut it off
length on the stumps, worked towards mid-on, Broad reacts quickly to prevent the single
lovely nut again, maybe could have been a touch fuller, shaping away past the bat
back of a length and tapped down to the leg side, Anderson hares after it but they make it through safely
bumper from Overton, clears Paine as he thinks better of pulling, YJB can only get the tips on it and Ben Foakes, on as a sub, can't quite prevent four byes - and that's the Aussie 250, too
pitched up and driven, Broad gets a hand on it but they pick up two more
pitched up on off, Paine blocks
comes across, length around off stump, pushed square
dug in, this lifts and hits the gloves as Paine drops back and fends it away
round the wicket, rising outside off and left alone
pitched up on off, Paine tip-and-runs into the covers, risky but they get through
pushed across from over the wicket, good carry but Marsh is happy to leave
fuller and straighter, comes forward and defends
on the stumps, again pushed away
angled across in the channel and Marsh is back to leaving
drops back and watches another slightly short ball through outside off
Paine gets into line and defends on off stump
lets this one go in the channel
pitched up on off, Paine gets on to the front foot and blocks
dug in, Paine takes a blow again, the bottom hand comes off the bat as the ball squeezes the index finger... They take one but Paine looks in pain, here
round the wicket to Marsh, who is making like a tree once again
good length, bit of nibble as Marsh pushes forwards, beaten but there's no wood on it
nice line straight up, gets Paine pushing forward outside off, takes the edge but it falls short of the slips!
touch back of a length, left alone in the channel
drops short and sliding down the leg side, innocuous stuff
length ball around off stump, jabbed into the covers
slightly back of a length, 132kph and Paine throws the hands up, close to the top of of... but not close enough
shortish outside off and Paine leaves again
slapped into the covers to start Moeen's day
a touch too short, and cut in front of point
over the wicket, and far too short from Moeen, so much time to climb into a pull. Deep midwicket intercepts
that's a better length, drawing Marsh forward and playing around his front pad
half an advance to block back down the pitch
edged, and short of slip! That's the length, drawing the left-hander forward but turning away. Nudged outside off, but dying short of Root
outside off, back of a length, no stroke needed there
nips off the pitch, into the thigh pad
leaning forward and pushed to cover
back of a length, a good sharp call for a single as Paine drops the ball off his hip into the leg-side
round the wicket, nibbles off the seam, through to the keeper
width and crashed to point
tossed up and walloped! A crashing drive through the covers. Nice!
held back in the flight, clipped back down the pitch to the bowler
that's a probing length, on and around off stump, luring the batsman forward
looped up, bites the turf, defended high on the bat. Decent nut
a good little rhythm now for Moeen, who's found the spot to the right-hander, just outside off
a fraction shorter, a well-judged single, punched on the up through point
a sharp bouncer, but too sharp. Out of Paine's reach
tapped to cover
on the hip and nudged into the leg side
round the wicket, jagging back off the seam, and Marsh wears it on the thighpad as he leaves well alone
still too short to threaten
a mistimed drive to mid-on
leaning out of the crease, punched to long-on
round the wicket, cramped for room
forward and blocked
on the toes, clipped calmly with a slight shuffle down to meet the pitch
on the back foot, tucked to midwicket
a compact drive to Broad at mid-off, who tumbles to gather
flicked on the up to mid-on, a tidy over
round the wicket, banged in short
clipped on the up to mid-on. Anderson pounces well with a dive
inside-edged drive into the leg-side
drilled through the covers as Woakes overpitches, and Broad can't cut that one off. Probably could have done better to be honest. Marsh's first four in an hour and a quarter
driven to cover, Moeen half-stops, stretching to his right
left alone with a flourish outside off stump
sharp turn, but all the way down the leg side. A cluster of fielders round the bat, but Cook at leg slip can't gather that one
standing tall on the back foot to defend
nudged into the leg side
on the back foot, and blocked
flicked to the leg side
yeehar! Have some of that! In the slot from Moeen, so Paine opened his shoulders, climbed through with the bottom hand, and tonked it high and handsome over wide long-on!
nudged into the covers
fully forward, bottom hand coming into play again to drive through mid-on, and there is Paine's fifty. A tremendous battling innings that has ridden the storm for Australia
wider line, left alone
wide on the crease, full length, blocked to midwicket
forward and pushed to cover
angled bat, into the off side
outside off
signs of spin, but too short, and cut into the gap
looped onto a good length, pushed back down the pitch
fired across the right-hander from round the wicket, Paine's eyes light up at the width, and he slashes gratefully through third man
looped up, defended down the track
fully forward, Marsh presents a full face as well. None shall pass, like Gandalf. Or David de Gea
short and wide, and crashed gleefully over point! England can feel their hopes of a sub-400 total slipping away with every run now
bouncer, Paine ducks
leaning back as Overton aims short once again
short again. A definite tactic developing in this over, similar to Jake Ball (remember him?) to Smith at Brisbane
and there it is! The short approach pays off this time! Paine swings into a pull, Moeen is lurking at deep square leg, and England finally prise the opening!
round the wicket, a fuller length, punched to cover
round the wicket, blocked
drawn onto the front foot to defend again
a hint of turn, takes a fat edge and deflects down to gully
advancing down the pitch to defend, pushed firmly back to the bowler
forward once more, using his feet well to get to the pitch of the ball outside off
crease-bound in defence this time as Moeen aims a notch fuller
round the wicket, attacking the splice, fenced into the off side
shorter but not properly short. Starc stands firm on the back foot to defend
nudged off the hip to mid-on
short and wide of off stump, Starc won't be drawn
pokey in defence, on the back foot. The ball pops up off the splice, but wide of Overton in his followthrough
driven to cover, a hint of a fumble and they gallop through for a cheeky single
round the wicket, blocked under the eyeline
pushed to point off the back foot
stretching forward, using those long levers to smother what little spin there is
another big stride, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up, and clipped to mid-on
beaten by turn and bounce! Perfect length, leaps past the edge, and Bairstow can't gather either. Sharp delivery. Though Nathan Lyon is probably just as intrigued by that...
round the wicket, slower ball, full length, cautiously blocked to the leg side
on the back foot, looking to be aggressive, but keeps it measured with a stabbed block to the off side
down the leg side
beaten outside off, a bit of a flaccid waft as Overton finds some lift off the deck
a sharp single to point! Starc was not ready to respond and Stoneman's shy misses the stumps by a whisker. He'd have been out by two feet!
full length, blocked to the off side
turning and bouncing outside off, and compactly slapped through point
drawn onto the front foot from round the wicket
angled defence into the off side
up on the toes, deflected into the off side
big stride, extra air from Moeen, but Starc is watchfully onto the front dog
turn from a leg-stump line. Starc blocks on the back foot this time
round the wicket, banged in short, a round-house pull to midwicket
angled into the off side
attempted yorker, but well dug out, into the leg side, through the legs, it would appear
forward and pushed to cover
another compact block on the back foot
into the leg side off another inside-edged drive. There's the 300
beauty! Turn and bounce, and beating the edge of a defensive bat
shorter and wider, steered into the off side
pushed firmly to point off the back foot
down the leg side, swept with ungainly effect. off the back of the glove it would appear, but perfectly safe. No one on the 45 so a long chase for slip
driven off the back foot to the off side
tossed up, and squeezes off an inside edge, through backward square. A decent delivery, but Australia march on
beaten and is that a chance? I think so, outside off, seemed to graze the edge but Bairstow couldn't gather. EDIT: Snicko is inconclusive, to be fair. He'd have got away with it
pushed back down the pitch
forward and pushed to point
outside off, left alone
a bit more round-arm from Root this time, fired into the pads
leaning forward and confidently smothered on the front foot
round the wicket, sliding on to the pads, Marsh clips it away square and runs two to bring up his second fifty in as many innings. Been a doughty knock
gets across his stumps to defend
on the pads again, 130kph from Broad, easing into his work after the break, clipped square for one more

speared in to the body, Starc defends and gets a thick inside edge on to his pad that loops to leg... Broad lopes after it and then fires a throw at the non-striker's end, where Marsh was well in, hitting the stumps and gifting Australia a couple more as it deflects away
line and length, defended coming forwards

banged in, Starc pulls but the ball dollies up to the leg side and Anderson takes a simple running catch coming in from mid-on! Broad does it again in the first over after resuming play - just the (re)start England needed
angled across and left alone outside off
length, close to the off peg but Marsh judges it well and leaves
touch shorter, rising in the channel and there's no stroke again
Marsh drops back and across, dabbing one into the covers and he's happy to take one
targeting the top of off stump, Cummins shows it a diligent straight bat
shoulders arms and he's hit on the thigh pad, coming back in from short of a length
length on off stump and Marsh presses forwards and inside-edges to the leg side for another single
back of a length, good carry as Cummins draws his bat inside the line
chin music, feisty bouncer from Broad, just wide enough that Cummins has time to move out the way
banged in again, this is right over the crouching batsman, no danger
short again, does well to get his gloves out of the way again... Dar signals the second above shoulder height for the over
back of a length, running his fingers down the side for the break from leg, Cummins leaves again
boshed! Too full from Anderson, in the slot to drive and Marsh grabs the keys, hops into the soft top and slams his foot down
draws his length back, in the channel but short enough that Marsh can leave without bother
back of a length again, no need to play
better length, in the channel and it stays a little low through to Bairstow
tight, fourth-stump line, Marsh is judging them well and again shoulders arms
pitched up on off, tapped towards cover point and there's no run
fullish and pushed square coming forwards
good-length ball on off, Cummins gets across and shows it a straight bat
in the channel, 136kph but not going off the straight and the batsman can watch it through
props forward on off, gets a thick inside edge
slightly full but the ball is keeping schtum now, Cummins lines it up to block
back of a length, attempts to leave and gets some bat on it but the ball bounces out of harm's way
oof, beats him on the inside, pitched up and nibbling enough to get through Marsh, but no damage done
length around off stump, defended
pitched up and Marsh drives, briefly in the air towards cover
full, 134kph and straightening a fraction as Marsh comes forward and blocks
good length in the channel, Marsh has been very careful to leave those
full and driven, not out of the middle but he controlled it well and it slipped past the diving Moeen at point to zip to the boundary
in the channel outside off, doesn't tempt the batsman
dug in short, knock-your-block-off stuff from Broad but Cummins isn't interested in a fight
short of a length, 132kph over the stumps, defended into the off side
Cummins continues to line the up well as he comes across and blocks on off
oh, not far off a caught-and-bowled chance! Cummins pops a drive back and Broad dives for it but the ball lands a yard or two short
banged in, flying through as Cummins makes a late decision to attempt a ramp

raps the pads, England appeal... and then Root reviews Chris Gaffaney's not-out call; but although there was no bat and it looked good on line, the ball was shown to have pitched outside leg stump. So England lose one of their two reviews
131kph on off stump, comes across to defend
tight line and Cummins greets it with a straight bat
digs one in short and Cummins sways out of the way
length ball on off, 134kph and pushed back down the track... Still not much in the way of succour for Anderson
fading in on a length, slapping the pads as Marsh comes forward, Broad appeals but that was going well down the leg side and they pinch a leg bye
touch back of a length outside off, 135kph and left alone
plugging away in the channel, Cummins happy to leave - even though he is still yet to score
diligent lines, presses forward to defned
touch straighter and worked back to the on side
at the body, this rises to hit Cummins on the hip as he moves across on to off stump
slightly short and leg side and Marsh tucks one off his body
good length and blocked to the off side
chance to score here, as Anderson drops short and wide but Cummins steers it to backward point

lovely bowling, shaves the outside edge but falls short of Bairstow! Anderson looks like a man who fell into a barrel of boiled sweets and came out sucking his thumb... Perfect line, straightened off the pitch, got the nick but not the carry, as Anderson's rum luck continues
turned to the leg side form the crease, still no run for Cummins
back to defending on off stump
round the wicket, rising on the leg side and Marsh calmly nudges it away for one again
pitched up and driven, without timing and Broad cuts it off and mid-on
comes across and blocks on off stump
runs, four of them! Cummins silences the obscure-records chatter with a smart back cut wide of the slips that skips away to the rope
nicely bowled in response, holding its line outside off and beating the outside edge
shuffles across his stumps and works the ball away
round the wicket, pushed through on off and cut towards point
dragged down a little and Marsh plays a precise whip off his legs, excellent power and placement to get it in front of the man in the deep
tossed up and tapped away coming forwards
presses forward to defend on off
flatter, angled in with the arm, blocked again
this time Marsh waltzes down and Matildas a single through mid-on to keep the strike
short ball, into the body and Marsh swats it away to deep backward square leg
pitched up and driven, not out of the meat and it dribbles towards mid-off
length ball, tapped into the off side
short outside off and Cummins has a waft, going for the back cut again, past the top edge and through to YJB
bangs in the bumper, Cummins ducks it
shortish outside off and dabbed down towards point
tossed up and defended on the front foot
drops a touch short and Marsh stays back to punch this down the ground to long-on for one more
over the wicket, spinning in from outside off, Cummins keeps it down in defence
pushed through and tapped into the covers
slower delivery, wider and Cummins pushes for it and mistimes to mid-off
flighted, gives Cummins room to clear the front leg and swipe down the ground, fetched past mid-on and it scuttles away for four more
defended from the crease
short, spanked for four more, Marsh swivelling on a pull and it beats the man on the fence again
nicely played, slightly wrong-footed by some seam movement but he guides it down between slip and gully for a few more
pitched up and chipped, in the air but it clears Overton in his follow through, runs down the ground for another three to bring up the Australia 350
round the wicket, 128kph in the channel, left alone
pitched up and this nibbles back a smidge, does Marsh as he pushes forward
round the wicket, looped onto a good length, and blocked
too short, hoisted high and expansively down to Broad on the midwicket rope, who jogs round to gather
solidly onto the front foot, and blocked
probing line from Moeen, but Marsh won't be hurried, leaning onto the front foot again
shorter this time, whipped to short midwicket off the back foot
leg-sided, swept, very fine. Marsh marches on
good line to the left-hander who shoulders arms as the ball jags back off the seam. A polite enquiry, but clearly going over
more nip from a good length, wriggles through the defences to strike the back pad
on the hip, and clipped to leg
outside off, through to the keeper with slightly sluggish carry
angled into the right-hander, squirted down through the cordon
solidly drawn onto the front foot. Probing from Woakes, but it's all pretty comfortable for the Aussies
tossed up outside off, and left alone
tighter line, defended out to point
striding onto the front foot to block
defended on the back foot
a tentative poke to a better-length ball, worked into the leg side off an inside edge, but it's enough to rotate the strike
forward and defended
cramped for room on leg stump, tucked off the hip
bouncer, Cummins limboes effectively to get out of harm's way
a crashing cut! That is supreme, Woakes serves up a short, wide offering, and gets utterly lambasted through the covers!
better line, targetting the top of off, but back of a length. Oodles of time to line it up and block
a judicious leave outside off, he's a very organised player
stabbed into the leg side again
back of a length, whipped firmly through midwicket
solidly onto the front foot
too short, that's a rank leg-stump long hop, and Cummins belts it behind square, sending Stoneman under the lid scurrying for cover
forward and pushed down the track
nudged off the legs
solidly onto the back foot to defend
line and length, but a distinct lack of menace as Marsh stretches onto the front foot
squeezed to cover off the front foot
outside off stump, and another leave
too short, too wide, too easy. Marsh lays bat on ball to guide a facile four through third man, and Australia march on
wide again, but a sharper delivery, no contact on an attempted slash
better ball, tight to off stump and climbing sharply
reaching forward to block
on the pads, flicked square
that is terrific! Making room, striding forward, launching his hands through the line, and easing a one-bounce four over the bowler's head
down the leg side
pushed back down the pitch
flicked off the pads, was there bat on that? I think not, as Stoneman can't gather at short leg either way
full length, attacking off stump, blocked to the off side
an easy leave for Marsh as Woakes pulls his length back
another leave, but a much better ball, as this one bends back late to pass excruciatingly close to off stump
forward and blocked on the front foot. It's powderpuff from England at present
drilled into the covers, picks the gap in the inner ring but not the outer circle
left alone as Woakes fires it out wider
crashed hard to cover. Lovely strike for no run
short and leg-sided, clipped on its way
on the toes, clipped to the leg-side
solidly into line
pushed diligently into the covers
swung into the leg side as Moeen drops short. He'll keep the strike
outside off, and through to the keeper
a calm leave to a tight line outside off
angled bat, another smart single to third man as Marsh moves into the 90s
forward to block
shorter, doesn't get up much, Cummins lines up a limbo cut, but can't make contact
tucked into the leg side. Such easy pickings. Australia are not breaking sweat at present
spanked high and effectively through the leg side! That's symptomatic of Moeen's lack of turn. Cummins trusted himself to heave across the line with impunity
forward to drive, into line once again
round the wicket, clipped urgently to the leg side
crunched! Too wide from Moeen, Marsh used his feet, and his confidence, to pound him majestically through the covers
another flicked single to the leg-side. He's closing in...

biff! Does Cummins sense the chance for some quick kills before a late onslaught with the ball? This is utterly clobbered off a good length, travels fast and flat, dipping just inside the rope. England are getting a schooling in this session
outside off, left alone
short and wide. Smashed square. If Marsh is tightening up internally with his hundred looming, he isn't showing a jot of nerves up front
banged in short. No stroke offered
on the hips, nudged square
short, and pulled supremely through square leg. Off comes the lid, and that is Marsh's century!
bouncer, avoided with a flinch
short, ducked
on the pads, flicked fine
wide line, an under-edged cut to Overton's slower ball
round the wicket, angled into the stumps. Blocked again
another slower ball, and a loopier full length this time! Marsh doesn't pick it at all and all but drags it onto his stumps. Cunning
firmly punched to cover
short and left alone
chopped down to third man, very cramped for room on the short ball, but somehow gets over his shot. Every closer to a richly deserved fifty
on the back foot, poked out to point
flicked behind square for another single

spliced and dropped in the gully! Deary me, it's all going wrong for England, a sharp lifter from Woakes, Marsh can't get on top of it, Cook appeared to reach the ball low to his left, but Vince, diving to his right, from a wider gully, punched it out of his hand!
bouncer, ducked
pitched up from round the wicket and pushed down the ground for one
dug in, good bouncer, Cummins flaps it... straight down the throat of third man! England get yet another post-breakthrough, third wicket of the innings for Overton. The short stuff working (sort of)
short and a touch wide, sliced away through backward point for a couple
comes across and pushes into the off side
width again, Marsh slashes this over slip, healthy top edge and it runs down to third man for four
good length, defended into the off side, leaving Lyon strike for the next over
banged in short, Lyon attempts to give it the heave ho to leg, ends up wearing the ball on his shoulder
banged in short again and Lyon swishes at it, not far from gloving through to the keeper
short ball, Lyon tries to swing himself off his feet again, fails to connect
banged in, another filthy yahoo from Lyon. He's not much interested in getting into line
bumper, soaring over the flailing Lyon's horizontal bat
pitched up to finish, not accurate enough and it's whupped through the covers... but there's a man out there and they decline the single
touch short outside off and cross-batted over the covers, this time they do run one
tries the bouncer straight away, this time Lyon connects... and it goes aaaaaaaaaaaalllllllllll the waaaaaaaaaayyyyyyy! Top-edged for six, well beyond the catcher down at fine leg
more short stuff, swing and a miss this time
short, Lyon backs away and fails to connect again
another filthy smear, top-edged over the keeper - couple more there! YJB hurtled after it but was never in the races for a catch
over the wicket, full and wide and this time he chops a couple through the covers. Needless to say, the crowd are loving this
Broad manages to get one through wide of the stumps
banged in, Marsh knows what to do with the short ball, crumped forcefully through midwicket and it beats the man in the deep for another salt-flavoured boundary
goes full, moral victory for the bowler but four more runs to Marsh, squeezed out down to fine leg
hammered straight! One-day batting now, Marsh channels Maximus Decimus Meridius and unleashes hell, a catapult barrage to a length ball, sailing beyond the rope
switches over the wicket, full and wide and plopped into the covers
dug out and they scamper through as Broad throws down the stumps - and there's the declaration, Smith calls them in!
tears in, 145kph straight away and hurled down short and a foot wide of off stump, Cook phlegmatically adjusts his tie clip and leaves
back of a length, 144kph at the body, shovelled away through square leg, that's a single to get off the mark
puts it on a length, Stoneman gets on to the front foot and blocks short of extra cover, they get through as Warner pounces on it and unleashes a throw
touch back of a length, this is 146kph/90mph but Cook judges the line and shoulders arms as it whizzes through past off stump
full, approaching 150kph, Starc turning up the heat early, nicely played with a punched drive but mid-on scoots across to prevent any runs
on the stumps, maybe looking for the yorker but not quite full enough, dug out to the leg side - 150.5kph to finish off a natty first over from Australia's strike bowler
starts full and wide of the stumps, Stoneman again is on the move to chop a single in front of square
touch back of a length, 139kph over the stumps, Cook again tucks one through square leg
ooh, tempting line, a pair of lacy undies in the corridor, Stoneman has a brief flirt with it but survives
good length in the channel, lets this one go
overpitched, 142kph, Stoneman is into his work, well forward to punch past mid-off, won't run all the way though
ripping ball to finish the over, very tentative footwork from Cook, flashing past the outside edge
swing for Starc, takes the leading edge as Stoneman gets squared up, but it flies high and wide of backward point, worth four in the end
length ball, Stoneman remains calm and lets this go
ooh-wee, that's a fiendish ball, 146kph and pitched up, shaping late as Stoneman attempts to drive, beaten like a kipper!
full and straight and Stoneman manages to squeeze a single into the on side
dug in short, 146kph and Cook swats a pull on the bounce to square leg
pitched up, full and looking for away swing but Cook covers the line and drops his bat on it
rapped on the pads, Hazlewood likes it, imploring for lbw... but I think that pitched outside leg
pitched up in the channel, shaping back in, superb line but Stoneman judges it well and leaves
fourth stump, hinting at coming back but not enough to make him play
goes for the yorker, 144kph as Stoneman jams down on it... and it's taken a chunk out of the toe of the bat! Brutal
in the channel, lets this one go again
length, on the pads and again Hazlewood goes up, Aleem Dar not interested - pitched well outside leg this time
full outside off, Cook is well forward to greet this one
superb ball, full in the channel and shaping away as Cook reaches for it and is beaten
comes across and blunts the swing this time
goes a touch too straight, 146kph but Cook uses that to his advantage and flicks three through midwicket
touch back of a length on middle and off and Stoneman gets in behind it
full length, Stoneman clips slightly uppishly to the leg side, it lands short of midwicket and then slips through him to give away the single
pitched up but this is a touch wayward and Cook rams it off his pads through square, beats the sweeper and thuds into the ropes
full again, no sense that Australia are going to waste this new-ball swing... Cook stuns it with the middle of his bat
pitched up on the pads and again Cook squirts a run through midwicket with a trademark nurdle. He's into double-figures for the first time this series
fullish, not so much swing for Hazlewood, defended on off stump
short, width for him to free the arms, he cracks a cut in the air, backward point thought he was in the game but it shot past him almost before he could leap and rattled to the fence
back of a length and there's room for Stoneman to tuck in on the cut again, chopped past point and they run two
fullish length, drifting into the pads and worked to midwicket
short ball, down the leg side and Paine can't quite hold it - Stoneman wanted a run but Cook wasn't moving
zipping through in the channel outside off
pitched up, 147kph and Cook shows it a broad blade in defence
dug in, Cook rides the bouncer well, pulled with control for one to deep square leg

yorker from Starc, screeches into the pads - and Gaffaney gives it, after some thought! Stoneman reviews, it was a touch leg side but he was a long was back in the crease - and Hawk-Eye shows it smashing leg stump flush on! That's gone, the DRS isn't coming to Engand's rescue. Starc rips out the first!
Hazlewood thunders in now, defended on off stump
pitched up, comes across and blocks
in the channel outside off stump, Cook lets this one go
length down the leg side, Cook fiddles at it and Paine appeals for the catch behind - flicked the pad
pitched up a foot or so outside off, left alone as he comes across
good pace and bounce, Cook is able to leave on length, though, as it flies over the stumps
goes full straight away, not quite yorker-length, Vince chops down on it and squeezes it out towards third slip, who snaps it up on the bounce
full outside off, angled across the right-hander from over the wicket, left alone
zinged down, swerving away as Vince presses forwards, testing line and it beats the bat before thumping into the gloves
shortish, 145kph and tapped down square of the wicket
pitched up, quite wide of the stumps and there's no need for him to play
full on the pads and Vince misses out, connects well but sends it straight to square leg on the bounce
woof, that's a snorter to begin with, did it flick the edge? Australia certainly thought so but not enough to try and overturn Aleem Dar's not-out decision... Yep, good call, brushed the back pad
good length outside off, wide enough for Cook to lean out and usher it through without alarm
touch short of a length, 137kph and defended on the back foot
in the channel, shaping back a touch but no stroke
touch back of a length again, testing line as Cook thinks about fencing at it in the channel
length ball, defended solidly coming across on off
touch short outside off and Vince starts with a neat punch through the covers for a couple to get off the mark
angled in straighter, worked off the pads
length, 136kph and met solidly coming forward to block on off stump

edged and gone! Regulation nick off, Vince's resistance wilts to his fourth ball of the day! There was no need to play at this, really - back of a length and rising in the channel, for some reason Vince felt compelled to try and force it away, but only succeeded in tickling through to the keeper. Loose and goosed
Hazlewood probes away outside off, good length and springing through to Paine as Root leaves
fullish, tight on off stump, Root defends on the front foot
pitched up on off, some shape in as Cook defends
rising in the channel outside off and left alone
pitched up, 138kph on middle and leg, Cook whisks it away through midwicket for a couple, his first runs of the morning
nudged into the covers and they scuttle through
pitched up, 140kph and Root meets it coming forwards, checked towards mid-on
full and straight, they're targeting Root's front pad already, he gets bat on it but not entirely convincingly, slightly overbalancing as he plays across the line
pitched up, that's too straight and in Cook's leg-glance comfort zone, he eases a couple more off his pads
length, in the channel, not much in the way of seam movement and left alone
perfect line and length, 139kph and Cook has a rare moment of indecision, comes forward and then thinks about leaving and ends up deflecting it down towards gully
pitched up and this is a more authoritative stroke, on to the front foot and oiling a cover drive into the green acres, Warner hurtles after it and keeps them to two
Cook gets into line and prods to the off side

bouncer from Hazlewood, he takes on the pull... and just manages to clear square leg! Not completely in control, the short ball getting ball getting big on Cook as it did in the second innings at the Gabba, but he gets a couple more
sliding into the pads and Root doesn't miss out this time, whipped through midwicket for two
touch short, outside off and tapped down square
on the stumps, searching for Kryptonite, taken smartly off the front pad with another wristy clip and they run hard for three
angled across, back of a length and left alone
dug in, 142kph and going away from Cook, he was shaping to pull again but decided the line wasn't in his favour and dropped the hands
length, 141kph a fraction outside off, Cook nonchalantly taps to the leg side and they saunter through
round the wicket to Cook, sliding down the leg side, flick and a miss
good length outside off stump, not coming in enough to make Cook play at it
oof, nearly suckered him this time, pitched up and nibbling off the pitch, beats Cook's attempted expansive drive. That's perhaps why he doesn't attempt expansive drives very often
back into leaving mode, shuffles across and watches it past
fired in and tucked to the on side
pitched up, 142kph on middle and off, tapped towards mid-on - good over from Hazlewood, a maiden
full, 141kph from Cummins, driven without timing towards mid-off
back of a length and guided down to third man, nicely played from the crease, using the pace and picks up four

full in the channel, Root goes hard... and slices to third slip! What a moment, England's captain gone! Cummins is stoked, Australia are in their element, a second wicket of the morning and it might be the nail in England's chances. Short and then full and Root wasn't in synch, thick-edging an ambitious drive
round the wicket, good length outside off and left alone
climbing to hit the outside edge - but it falls short of slip! More ominous signs for England
touch short, wide of the stumps and Malan is able to let it go
pushed into the body and Cook works one away
teasing line, rising outside off, Malan holds his bat inside it
good pace and carry, 142kph a few inches outside off stump, left again
dug in and Malan seems to register it late, attempts to pull and ends up looping a nervy splicer into a gap towards midwicket
length, sliding in straight, Cook nurdles one more off his legs
fullish, 138kph in the channel, Malan is watchful in letting it go
length ball, Cummins going round the wicket now, 138kph and tapped away
lets this one go in the corridor
