pitched up and Cook inside-edges a push on to his front pad... Cummins throws his hands to his head
fullish outside off, wide enough for him to ignore
banged in and Cook rides it, pulls smoothly and the man at square leg, a substitute fielder, lets it through him to gift four
comes across to defend
round the wicket, flight and straightening on off, Malan smothers it coming forwards
uses the feet, can't get to the pitch but he is close enough to block assertively
pushed through outside off and steered away on the back foot
tossed up, drifting slightly leg side, turned to short leg on the bounce
flighted, outside off and met coming forwards
Lyon drops short and Malan is deep in the crease now, plays it well and fillets a late cute behind backward point for his first boundary
coming back in the channel, not enough to make Cook play
pitched up and blocked solidly coming forwards
fullish outside off and Cook steps out to block the path
touch shorter, 146kph and on fifth/sixth stump, no need to play
whoosh, that's a false stroke, pace and bounce as the ball straightens a smidge off the pitch, Cook feeling for it unsuccessfully
goes straighter with his line and Cook uses that to his advantage to tuck one more off his body and retain the strike
Lyon creeps in and floats up a cherry bomb, there's some turn as Cook opens the face and prods square in defence
flighted, this grips even more and takes the edge, played softly though and it runs behind square for a couple
tossed up and Cook tries to drive, comes off the inside half of the bat
full, drifting in and worked away to the leg side
floated up on the stumps, Malan gives himself a little room and punches into the covers to turn over the strike
pushed through on off stump, solidly blocked half forward
good length, 135kph to start off with, Malan comes across to defend on off
short of a length, poked into the off side on the back foot

good length, veering in and striking the pads, Australia go up - and Dar gives it after an age! Malan is very quick to review, think this hit on the thigh pad to height must be an issue; yes, replays show it was high on the back leg, ball-tracking has it going over and the decision is overturned: Malan survives
touch short and defended calmly on off stump
fuller, sliding into the batsman, clipped away through backward square for one
144kph, Starc gearing up, full and defended into the covers coming forwards
drifting in with the arm, turned to leg
tossed up on the stumps, defended
uses the feet and drives, clipped firmly through the infield and mid-off does well to cut it off going to his right
presses on to the front foot to block
full outside off, given some air and Cook drives, can't get it through
finds the boundary, touch short from Lyon again and Cook gets busy with the fizzy to slam behind backward point
back of a length on off and defended from the crease

throat ball, Malan plays it well, deflected down behind Bancroft at short leg... but then he nearly runs himself out! Malan set off, Cook responded and then said no, and there was no chance of him getting back if the throw was any good. But it wasn't
on the stumps and turned to the leg side, this time he does get off strike
full and straight, worked away through midwicket
short ball outside off, Malan has a bit of a whoosh and fails to connect, Starc lets him know what he thinks of it
fullish outside off and poked into the covers
lovely bowling, extra spin and bounce for Lyon, past the outside edge as Cook hangs back
tossed up and met coming forwards
nicely flighted, this dips on Cook as he pushes at it, pops the ball back low in the air towards the bowler
flatter on the stumps, punched away
pushed through, Cook sits back and mistimes a prod into the off side
full, gets Cook driving, he plays it nicely but extra cover leaps to cut it off and keep the pressure on
banged in short, climbing through as the batsman levers himself out of the way
hurled down short and a touch leg side, enable him to hop across out of the line
bumper, again it sears through outside leg as Malan scurries out of the way
back of a length and this is defended in front of his stumps
short but only around hip height, 143kph and jabbed past the close fielder for a single to get up the other end
over the wicket to Cook, pitched up and it takes the inside edge on to the pads as he stretches forwards
tossed up on off and driven short of mid-off, Cummins is set back and they scamper one despite a direct hit
fizzed through on off, Cook leans out and defuses it
bit of grip and some excited noises from the men close in as Cook pokes away to the leg side
flatter, outside off and tapped square
tossed up, a foot outside off and straightening a touch as Cook gets forward and shoulders arms
pushed through, blocked to cover on the front foot
round the wicket, cramping Malan on the back foot, who jabs down late, eluding short leg with a well-angled deflection
banged in short, takes the glove
sharp and nasty, fizzing past the lughole! Head-hunting stuff
on the hip, tucked calmly behind square as Malan hops inside the line
short and firmly pulled to deep midwicket. Cook is looking composed in this innings, which is more than can be said for England in general

well, there we go, composure can go hang! Cook props onto the front foot, with two close catchers on the off side. Lyon tweaks one off his edge, and slip gobbles the offering with glee! A tame end to a doughty knock, and now the wheels are truly coming off England's innings!
yikes, start as you mean to go on, Mo! A huge slash outside off, and a loud noise of some sort. Bat on the keeper's gloves? The ball eluded the edge, just
excruciatingly tight to off stump as Moeen leaves
tight to off stump again, but good judgement
defended on the back foot
props solidly onto the front foot, and defended
round the wicket once again, cramping Malan for room
nudged off the hip, as Malan seeks out fine leg for another single
over the wicket to Moeen, as Starc rather fancies his hopes of luring a loose drive. Not this time
dangling the carrot outside off, Moeen leaves alone again
short outside the off stump, Moeen drops his wrists to allow the ball to fly by
fully forward and stabbed into the gap in the covers
outside off, cut hard to point
stretching forward, poked into the covers
left alone outside off, signs of turn for Lyon
lovely line, good leave. On off stump and straightening past Moeen's upraised bat. Lyon wanted that one to zip straight on
nudged to leg off the front foot
wafted into the off side with typically Mo-ish insouciance
on the pads, swinging down the leg side, and flicked fine. They all count
onto the front foot, punched to the off side
tight line from round the wicket, Moeen slides across his crease to nudge another nurdle to leg
defended off the hip once more
another attempted nudge to leg, strikes the pad this time and bobbles down into the crease
left alone and no stroke offered
stretching forward
pushed onto the back foot this time, as Moeen shuffles into line to push to point
outside off, harmlessly ushered through to the keeper
fully forward and defended back down the pitch
smashed into the leg side but no way through
a yawning stride down the pitch. Blocked with resolve
forward and defended
short and ducked
very full, threatening to swing, driven down the pitch
shuffles into line, defended down into the crease
banged in short, pulled off the eyebrows with an effective roll of the wrists. Well played
banged in short, Moeen ducks
forward to defend
advancing to meet the pitch, comfortably punched into the gap at mid-off
squared up on a good length, defended
well bowled again, attacking the stumps and forcing Moeen to put bat on ball
advancing to meet the pitch of the ball once more, blocked back to the bowler

yowser! That explodes off the pitch, takes the shoulder of the bat and rips off Paine's elbow and over the slips! But the danger isn't over yet, as Malan calls the single and Moeen has to scamper to make his ground! Technically, that's a drop, and a run-out chance
less drama in this delivery, from round the wicket
tapped to short leg as Moeen hangs back in his crease
on the pads, worked into the leg side with a late turn of the wrists
on the back foot, defended to the off side
another bouncer, but veering away down the leg side as Malan ducks early
full length and punched down the ground. Compact stroke, right under the eyeline
forward and blocked into the off side
more expansive from Malan, hanging back in the crease, and flirting a late punch into the off side
on the back foot, a more conventional glide into the off side
nudged into the leg side
sliding onto the pads this time, and that's a tremendous wallop from Moeen, sighting it early and smashing his sweep hard through square leg
wider outside off, and Moeen has his dander up. Another belligerent slog through the leg side. Good intent. Those are England's first boundaries for 15 overs!

another bouncing bomb outside off stump, it jags back viciously from just back of a length, flicks the inside edge and sails through to Paine behind the stumps! Malan has to go this time, and England's Ashes are in a smouldering heap!
leans onto the front foot, eased into the covers. Well played and placed
back of a length, tight line, Bairstow thinks of playing a stroke and thinks again
through to the keeper with a flashy, flat-footed drive. Careful now!
short. Ducked
driven again, slightly flat-footed as Bairstow resolves to lay bat on ball from the outset
round the wicket, defended on the back foot. Lyon's length is by and large immaculate
extra air on this delivery, dips late on middle and leg, and blocked
stabbed back to the bowler, in the air for a split second
leaning forward, head over the ball to defend
aggressive intent from Moeen, dancing down the pitch, slightly deceived in flight, but adjusts his shot well to punch through the covers
sharp turn from off to leg, Bairstow tucks it off the hip for the single to backward square
outside off, no stroke offered
pop-a-doodle-doo! Full length, Bairstow,defends and loops a teasing lobbed block back down the pitch. Any straighter, and the bowler would have gobbled that in his followthrough
back of a length, defended on the crease
fuller length, outside off, a firm punch into the covers
crikey! Bairstow's determination to drive is so nearly his downfall! Perfect length from Cummins, nibbling off the deck, and beating a firm-footed waft by a matter of nanometres
good aggressive follow-up, a well-directed bouncer, just to keep Jonny honest. But he's got a good head on those shoulders...
leaning forward to defend down the pitch
a wristy nurdle from a fuller-length delivery, tucked out to midwicket
on the back foot, defended on the up, into the leg side
turning down the leg side
dancing feet from Bairstow, trying to create an angle, punched out to point
'bowled Gaz'... another attacking tweaker, on a middle and leg line,  Bairstow punches back to the bowler off the back foot
tapped to the leg side
fully forward and drilled to short cover. A good compact drive for no runs
worked into the gap
extra pace, extra nip, that's a cracking delivery. Hits the seam, explodes past another urgent push from Bairstow. His edge is living dangerously
that's better from Bairstow! Fuller, straighter, driven through long-off. A confident stride, head over the ball, biffed with intent
beaten again. This a cracking duel, as Cummins finds that no-man's length once again, to leave Bairstow hanging outside off
good use of the feet as Moeen biffs a drive to mid-off
tight line and length, threatening to turn back into the stumps as Bairstow drives off the back foot
Bairstow returns the strike to his partner
sharp turn! Moeen is lured by that one as it tweaks past his edge
outside off, good lines, no stroke this time
striding forward, tucked to mid-on
driven through the covers! That's the length that Bairstow's been waiting for, head over the ball, clean through the ring
looking for the drive again, but not quite there this time, looked like a cutter, as it popped off the face of the bat
on the back foot, tapped down into the crease
outside off, through to the keeper on a wafer-tight line
banged in short, no stroke offered
outside off, through to the keeper once again
punched out through point
up on the toes once more, pushed to cover
tossed up, dips outside off, Bairstow chisels a single past the outstretched hands of the bowler
forward and tucked into the leg side
tucked to the leg side
big turn outside off, a well-judged leave from Moeen, and a groan of appreciation from the keeper
edged, and well snaffled on the bounce at third slip by Bancroft! Threatening
a touch straight, Bairstow accepts the pad-side offering and nicks the single
on the back foot, blocked down into the crease
well driven as Cummins over-pitches, outside off and firmly guided down the ground
outside off, no stroke offered
tucked into the leg side, and that will be tea
round the wicket to Moeen, who leans out and dinks a drive through the covers for one
over the wicket now, tossed up and pushed into the covers
shorter, goes back and nudges away to leg
dragged down a little short and spinning to leg, the sweep is on but Bairstow doesn't quite get hold of it
goes back and works a straight ball through the leg side
flatter outside off and Moeen pats it to cover off the back foot
round the wicket, full in the channel, nothing doing (yet)
fired in straighter, 139kph on middle, calmly clipped towards midwicket
very full and wide, Bairstow isn't quite alert to the possibility of spanking the full toss and misses with a drive
dug in, 140 kays, hops back into line and blocks
slung down, climbing rapidly and homing in from wide of the wicket, not close enough to make him play
touch short of a length again, 140kph a foot outside off and YJB ignores it
dances down, bit of a woolly woof from Moeen, thickish outside edge as drives over cover but it lands safely

flight and dip, it's chipped back in the air, waaaaaaaaayyyy to the left of the bowler... only for Lyon to pluck a one-handed screamer! Holy smokes! That's not nice, Garry, it's sensational! Slightly loose from Moeen, done by the ball dropping on him, but the connection was firm and it brought out the Superman in Lyon as he soared to his left and grabbed it with the surety that characterises everything Australia do right now
over the wicket now, tossed up and defended watchfully
comes across and pushes the ball away
spinning in from outside off, Woakes nudges it down
uses the feet, comes down and covers the line to push a single into the covers and get off the mark
short and rising as Woakes stays deep and gets in behind it to defend
another bumper, kept out phlegmatically
snorting bouncer, a real perfume ball - smell that - as Woakes wobbles on the back foot and manages not to get anything on it
short, not rising quite as high and this is defended from the crease
banged in and banged out of the middle, Woakes nails a pull behind the man at deep square and picks up four - although I'm fairly certain he had his eyes closed
ooh, good riposte, square him up with a lifter that goes away and takes the edge but flies short of gully
Lyon into an easy rhythm, as ever, defended coming forwards
gives it some air, YJB props forward and gets a thickish inside edge for one
tossed up outside off, lets this one go through to the keeper
shouts of 'catch it!' as the ball grips and hits the edge before popping off the pad... but it's well short of the leg-side catcher
tentative movements forward, deflected down towards short leg with the turn
flighted outside the line of off, comes forward and taps it away
short and rising over the stumps, Bairstow gets into line and repels it
back of a length, too straight, no reverse as yet for Starc, clipped through square leg to the sweeper
over the wicket to Woakes, slanted across him as the batsman hangs back
through him, fiendish line and the extra bounce as the ball leaves Woakes has him poking at thin air
done him again, short enough to leave but there's not much room for clear thinking in these circumstances as Woakes flirts with it and the ball shoots through
hops back in the crease and jabs to the off side, picks up a single
floated up full on off, Woakes blocks
gives it some air, defended stoutly coming forwards
nicely flighted and this bounces up to hit Woakes on the body as he played back, off the inside edge in fact, but landing at his feet rather than in the eager paws of a catching fielder
tossed up on the stumps and worked away to leg
Bairstow goes back and flicks another single through backward square
good length, turning in a fraction and defended on off

pitched up and driven in the air, Starc sticks out a hand... and juggles the rebound to complete the catch! Everything they touch turns to green-and-gold today! Bairstow departs now, staring at the heavens as England slide into Ashes hell. He struck the ball well but Starc reacted brilliantly, parrying it with his right hand and then turning to grasp it behind him
steaming bouncer to welcome him, climbing over the head of the new man
over the wicket, length on the body and fended through square leg for his first Test run
fierce, seaming away off a length, Woakes swishes airily at it and is beaten
hammers a length, 144kph on off stump, gets across to defend this one
fuller, Woakes presses forward and drives back to the bowler
pushed through, slightly leg side as Overton goes back on leg stump
floated up and pushed gently into the off side
tossed up, on the stumps and dinked down the ground to long-on
full and flighted, blocked coming forwards
Woakes comes forward but is suckered by the ball going on, a thick edge runs wide of the slips and they run well for three
full on the stumps and turned to the leg side
Starc bringing the heat, 145kph on a length, rebuffed into the off side
banged in short, aiming for the rib cage, Woakes manages to get across and throws his hands up to avoid damage
shuffles across and manages to stab a single through the covers
short and rising towards the body, 144kph as Overton jabs it away, just past Shaun Marsh at short leg!
rapid bouncer, horrible for the batsman to deal with, Woakes leaps for his life and manages to block it safely down in front of his feet
short and flung wide this time and Woakes responds with a meaty swipe through cover point to pick up four - and take England past 150 in the process. Small victories
back of a length, straightening a touch as Overton prods it away from the crease
steepling bouncer, hard for a tall man like Overton to get out of the way of... but he manages to
short, peppering the body, this nips back inside the bat and hits him on the thigh pad
short and wide and slapped through backward point, kept the ball down and there's no one out there to prevent four
oof, a genuine throat ball, Overton coming across and he has to take evasive action
banged in, 141kph and it's another beast of a ball to deal with, Overton manages to ride the bounce and drop it to earth
short and Woakes rides it to steer one away square of the wicket
banged in, rising like the Kraken from the deep, Overton fends it in front of short leg, where Bancroft snaffles it and then underarms on to the stumps - but the bat was grounded

short ball, swung away powerfully down towards fine leg, Hazlewood has to run around to his left but does brilliantly to reel the ball in one handed as it bounced beyond the rope, dragging it back to prevent four
Woakes jumps back and across to defend
bumper, slightly leg side, Woakes hops on the spot and jabs it away between the two close catchers
short ball (natch), Woakes pulls with something approaching confidence, between the two men in the deep but Hazlewood again does well to prevent a boundary
over the wicket, short and rising but again well dealt with
oh, nicely played, Overton makes sure to get forward and meets a length ball with a spiffy square drive that zips to the rope
short of a length outside the line of off stump, prodded down towards cover
yeow, 141kph and homing in on the bonce, punched down into the ground in front of short leg - still playing them pretty well
more chin music - or, more accurately, top-of-the-block music - flying through a matter of millimetres from Overton's helmet as he jumps and ducks at the same time
short and at the body but shovelled away behind square for a single
banged in short, down the leg side as Overton pulls and misses
very short, more of a danger to airplanes flying over Adelaide, called wide on height
COverton shuffles across and flicks a single off his hip to get off strike
thud, thud, thud - that's the sound of <del>England</del> the middle of the pitch taking a beating. Woakes ducks
short again and Woakes takes the bottom hand off as he steers it away to leg
yikes, spooned over short leg! Cummins goes over the wicket, bangs in a cobra of a bumper, it homes in on Woakes who somehow manages to get it up and over the man in close
fired in at the body and tapped away
outside off, back of a length, punched to cover
flipped off the hip ... in the air .... but short of deep backward square. A calculated risk. Sort of
fired into the pads, tucked round the corner
angled defence into the off side
attacking the ribs once again, Woakes is living dangerously with that fenced defence to leg
much fuller, and that was the one that Woakes was waiting for, a calm punch to mid-on, and this is now the best partnership of the innings. Sound the *fightback-starts-here* klaxon!
tight line, back of a length, blocked into the off side
propping forward, angled through point, useful accumulation
another well-directed bouncer, but Overton won't be drawn
tentatively forward to defend
back of a length once more, punched out to the off side
short and sharp, but Overton is equal to the task, dropping the ball at his feet like Obama dropping the mic. Without anything resembling the context of a job done, of course
width and walloped! Calypso-style, to boot, down on one knee, flashing the blade, and clean through point. Top boshing
up on the toes, tucked to leg. The patient continues to have a pulse
uncomfortably forward, poking a back-of-a-length ball back to the bowler
flipped up and off the toes, to midwicket
on the hips, flipped round the corner, more runs to the cause. Australia might need a slight rethink of their tactics here. This pair haven't enjoyed the short stuff, but they are enduring
fuller and straighter, worked to the leg side for another useful single
looks like it! Round the wicket, targetting the blockhole, but well enough dug out this time, out through midwicket
blocked back down the pitch from a fuller length again
round the wicket, solidly blocked on middle stump. Starc swoops in his followthrough
back of a length, and that's a solid punch through the gap in the covers. A sensible stand brewing between these two
short, sharp, spliced, safe. Woakes was looking to punch that through point but it kept getting bigger on him. No matter, it's a boundary and the 50 stand
full and threatening, angled in from round the wicket. Well dug out
tossed up from over the wicket, worked to the leg side
slightly shorter, flicked firmly round the corner
up on the toes, punched back to the bowler
extra flight and bite outside off, Woakes pokes forward with caution, pad and bat together to guard against the spin
nudged off the back foot to short leg
looped up and defended once again
forward and blocked
forward and cautiously blocked
banged in short, and Overton turns turtle
outside off, left alone (just about) as the ball nibbles off the seam
short, and leg-sided. A bit of a wasted delivery

that's an absolute pearler. Left-arm line from over the wicket, pitching on off, drawing the stroke, holding its line, and somehow failing to snick the edge through to the keeper. Can't do much with those
over the wicket, appreciable turn and a bit of a flat-footed back-foot block from Woakes, who isn't keen on over-committing
flipped to leg with an urgent whirlwind of the arms
patted back down the pitch
plant the front dog and heave-ho! Overton is bored of circumspection, and spanks a handsome slog-sweep through midwicket!
nudged round the front pad, another single
looped up, dips late, flicked down to mid-on
nurdled into the leg side
full-length outswinger, that's a dangerous delivery, but well watched all the way, and pushed out to cover
attacking the top of off from over the wicket, blocked firmly
defended on the back foot again
back of a length, a touch too wide, nipping unthreateningly past the edge
fuller length, wide line, safe enough to put bat on ball with a firm push. Deep point gathers and wings in a rather wild shy. It's all England at the moment!
forward and blocked
head over the ball, pushed to the bowler
another firm drive, but Lyon pounces in his followthrough
big turn, Lyon is up for an optimistic lbw appeal. That would have missed a third set
tapped to leg from a full length
better line and length, attacking the front pad from round the wicket. Blocked back down the line of the ball
round the wicket, worked with confidence into the leg side
another nudged single to leg
round the wicket, attacking the base of the off stump, but solidly dug out

oh, that is a terrible way to end a battling innings. A fraction short, Woakes is in no position for the pull, and a filthy top-edge plops straight up and straight back down into Starc's grateful hands!
up on the toes, jabbed to the off side
attacking the rib-cage from round the wicket. Broad hops into line to defend
banged in short, and Overton ducks
wow, that exploded from a good length, fizzed past Overton's nose as he just about kept his bat out of harm's way
short again, Overton flinches to let the ball sail over his head
line and length, solid one-handed block outside off
short and wide, slashed over third man. Useful runs, as England inch ever closer to resolving any argument about the follow-on
up on the toes, punched out to cover
round the wicket, beats the edge as Overton pokes forward with his feet stuck in clay
fuller length, squeezed out to cover
angled into the pads, tucked to the leg side
leaping across the crease, deflected fine off the thigh pad. More valuable runs
short and sharp, leaping past the edge as Broad drops his hands well
flicked into the leg side, to end another session of isolated competitiveness, but mostly remorseless Australian dominance
round the wicket, tossed up and spinning through outside off
Broad presses foward and pushes into the covers
drifting in with the arm and worked around the corner to get off strike
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed away
flighted, Overton plays positively, gets the front dog down the pitch and blaps four back past the bowler
floated up a touch leg side and Overton lets it spin through behind his legs
round the wicket, dug in short and Broad sways out of the way
rib-tickler from Cummins, he's turning his back on it and wears the blow
short ball, taken by the leaping Bancroft at short leg... was there any bat on it? Superb catch diving to his left, but it was off the body
stays back and manages to squirt one away to deep backward square
over the wicket to Overton, fullish outside off, gets him feeling for it but the thick edge runs low and wide of slip for one to third man
more bumper action, Broad is on the dodgems and again manages to jab one safely away between short leg and leg gully
tossed up from round the wicket and blocked
Broad props forward to defend
pushed through on the stumps, nudged away

turn and bounce, takes the edge! Broad knew but Gaffaney's finger went up to make sure - Lyon does it again, good ball to any batsman, let alone a tailender keen to hang back; just kissed the edge as he closed the face and Paine followed it well with the gloves
tossed up and there's spin again, past the edge as Anderson tries to force it off the back foot
flighted on off stump, blocked shuffling forwards
fiery bouncer to start with, Overton crouches out of the way
stays back in the crease and gets it into the covers but they won't get a run despite Overton being interested
pitched up and he tries to flay through the covers, manages to pick out mid-off
full and straight, plinked towards mid-on
short ball, Overton is forward and then crouching as he tries to hook-cum-sweep and fails to connect
banged in short and Overton doesn't bother to take it on

tossed up and Anderson is hit on the front leg trying to sweep - given! He reviews, which he might as well, hoping it's missing leg. But he hopes in vain, Hawk-Eye showing it to be smacking leg stump in the mush
touch back of a length, decking away as Bancroft drops into the crease and leaves
definitely some movement for Anderson, but again it's short enough to ignore
length around fourth stump, patted down into the off side
that's better length, shaping as Bancroft begins to think about a leg clip, the leading edge bobbles back to the bowler
in the channel, 130kph and left alone
pitched up and straightening a touch but Bancroft plays it smartly with low hands and an open face, guiding the ball to the boundary through backward point
pitched up, curling away... and it's signalled as a wide, to Broad's disgust
fullish and a couple of feet outside off, again holding its line and left alone by Warner
continues to go full in the channel, 133kph, no stroke
fired in straighter, 138kph on middle and off as Warner comes across and blocks
full on middle, it's angled in and then begins to curve as the batsman covers it and defends down the track

pitched up, flashes past the bat as Warner pushes without foot movement and Bairstow goes up... Broad says he couldn't hear anything but Root is keen and decides to review. Was there a thin edge? Well, neither Hot Spot nor Snicko thinks so, the decision stands, England's review is lost and the crowd gently gurgles in delight
in the channel, Warner goes back to leaving them be
full and swinging, Jimmy finds his groove but the outside edge is beyond the reach of Bairstow! He made a good diving effort but it bounced short of slip and Anderson practises his frown

oh, got him this time! Another juicy in-and-out burger, perfect new-ball delivery and Bancroft again has a little feel for it, just a scrape of the outside edge through to Bairstow and this time there's no doubt about the result. England amongst 'em
hello boys! Booming inswinger straight up and it nearly fillets Khawaja first ball, pitching just outside off and jagging back, past the bat and missing off by a whisker
touch shorter, again hooping in to hit the batsman on the body
pushes this across now, length ball threatening to nip away on off, defended off the outer half of the bat
pitched up around off stump, Khawaja presses forward and blocks assertively
oof, that's a good ball, the lights are infusing this pink pill with magical qualities once again, zipping off a length past the edge as Warner pokes
touch shorter and in the channel, he ignores this one
Warner dances across the ring and lands a punch, just a singe into the covers
Broad hits a tricky length just outside off, 138kph and holding its line, into the gloves as Khawaja is beaten
full in the channel, tip-toes across and leaves confidently
full, too straight this time, neatly clipped off the pads for his first run through midwicket
extra bounce, seaming away as Khawaja comes across, judges it pretty well
gets into line and taps down towards cover
length, 135kph and hinting at away movement, covers the line and blocks to the off side
good length outside off, holding its line after pitching but Khawaja doesn't follow it
ooh, jaffa cakes for tea! A nippy, zippy away-decker, pitching on and then scissoring past the outside edge as Khawaja gropes down the wrong line
shorter, again swerving away, Khawaja is nearly drawn into following it
pitched up from round the wicket and Warner gets into line
fullish, around off stump, not so much lavish movement for Broad and it's blocked again
pitched up but quite wide and he's happy to let this goes
jeepers, that's a sweet nut, you'd do well to get anything on one of those! Zinging in and straightening just enough, Warner prods and misses
makes a bit of room for himself and steers a single
fired in on a length, nips to take the edge but he keeps it down and it flies wide of the slips for four, much to Broad's chagrin
short and rising, that looked to surprise Warner a little, he drops the hands
comes across and defends a back-of-a-length ball
gets it up towards the blockhole, swerving late as Warner brings the bat down, an inside edge saves him from a more concerted lbw appeal
strays down the leg side
back of a length, curving away from Warner after hitting the seam, he just about has time to adjust and get his bat out of the way
length ball, a touch straight and nudged away
drops short, angling in to the body and Khawaja flips a couple past square leg
fired in over the stumps, Uzzie is moving across and it deflects behind square off his thigh pad for a leg bye
full length wide of the stumps, no interest from Warner

tempting length and big away swing for Broad, lures Warner into a drive - and this time Broad thinks there's an edge! Bairstow and Root know otherwise, a shake of the head sends Broad back to his mark. They'll not waste another one
climbing through off a length as Warner moves across and leaves
on to the front foot, shoulders arms again
Anderson continues to bustle in, pushed across the bows, no stroke
length ball on fourth stump, 133kph and not coming back, judged well and left
fuller, gets him playing this time, nibbles the edge but Khawaja keeps it down, on the bounce to gully
short of a length and down the leg side
on the stumps, Khawaja waits for it and taps to the on side
full and hurtling back in like a dervish from wide of off stump, but it was slightly off target and Khawaja is able to leave again
nice shape on the ball as Broad probes in the channel but again Warner is comfortable in leaving
full and on the pads, bit of a gimme and Warner chips it in the air, not all that far from mid-on but it runs away safely for a few
pushed through wide of the stumps, 138kph but no stroke demanded again
better line, full length and beginning to fade away as Khawaja gets across and pokes to cover
woof, beaten again, a teasing line from Broad but again it misses the edge... maybe still a smidgen short
full on the stumps and nudged away to the leg side for a single
oh, too good again, perfect length on middle-and-leg then jerking away from Khawaja, daylight between bat and ball but it flicked the back pad, eliciting an appeal from behind the stumps
full on the pads and he tickles this away for one
angled across, not close enough to make Warner commit
speared in and swinging but it's leg side and Warner is able to help it on its way past fine leg for his first boundary
that's the line, curling in but not quite full enough to defeat Warner, who punches back to the bowler
sidling through in the channel outside off, lets this one through
round the wicket, 125kph to start with and defended coming forwards
pitched up and nibbling away as Khawaja reaches out and manages to control a thick edge between the slips for four
goes a little straighter and Uzzie works to leg
digs in the short ball, 131kph but he rides the bounce and defends
easy-paced stuff, on the stumps and pushed towards mid-on
Overton goes short again and Khawaja picks up his second boundary of the over with a crisp pull through square
full and booming away towards the slips, wide enough to leave
puts it on a length in the channel, again Warner watches it through
round the wicket, pitched up and beginning to swing away, stabbed down towards backward point
back of a length, 135kph, jabbed down into the off side
full and swinging away in the channel, left alone again
pitched up, still quite wide and Warner doesn't need to follow it
bit of a loosener, short and wide at 128kph but Khawaja finds point with his cut shot
tighter to the stumps, 133kph and decent carry outside off but he's able to leave on length
angled across from over the wicket, not a great line and it drifts away further
touch short, seaming in appreciably, flies through at waist height as Khawaja shoulders arms
back of a length, 136kph and he's struck on the body attempting to leave again
slides on to the legs and clipped for one behind square
an extravagant out-jagger of a delivery, back of a length though, and easily left
fired down the leg-side, a scrambled stop from Bairstow
good ball, nipping back from outside off and cramping Warner's style, just as he was lining up the cut. Blocked in the end
full length, angled in, squirted to point
angled in from round the wicket, Warner is in no hurry to extend Australia's lead. Oodles of time left to do that tomorrow
on the legs as Anderson goes over the wicket this time, nudged down the leg side
crushing drive into the covers, but straight to the man
up on the toes, punched out to point
nurdled into the leg side
good leave, as Woakes fires one across the left-hander's bows, very tight to the top of off
left once again, good line, good leave
still nothing doing outside off stump
outside off, jagging off the seam but too wide to tempt a shot
a solid line and length, but Khawaja is unmoved
round the wicket, looking to angle away from the left-hander
sitting in on a tight line but it's stalemate at the moment
blocked into the off side
more nip off the seam this time as Khawaja wears this on the thumb
big nipper from Woakes, flirting past the edge like a pair of fluttering eyelashes
back of a length, patted down into the crease
stabbed back down the pitch
tapped out to point
fuller length, right under the eyeline as Warner drives into the covers
another over negotiated
very full, fair too wide from Jimmy
outside off, nipping away, easily ignored by Warner
tucked to leg

huge appeal, and Anderson may have broken through! Up goes the finger, but Khawaja has reviewed, after a long pause for thought, it must be added, so no chance he nicked it. The ball straightened on off stump, beat the edge, and was clipping off stump! Off he goes. Anderson gets reward for his perseverance, but it's hard to claim it's a lifeline
round the wicket, attacking the stumps from the outset. Jags late and Smith has to defend in haste
solidly on the spot. Impressive welcome to the crease from Anderson
outside off, through to the keeper with no stroke offered
through to the keeper again
on the toes, clipped to midwicket
defended again on a full length
edged and straight to second slip! Now then, is this a glimmer of a chance for England? Perfect line, nipping sharply off the seam, careering into the splice and straight into the bread-basket
edged but safe! Outside off, finds a thin nick but bounces in front of Root in the cordon. Things Are Happening

round the wicket, full length, and gone! Smith is reviewing but this is surely plumb... maybe just outside leg if anything, but it'll be umpire's call, you suspect. Smith simply played round a straight one. It pitched a millimetre outside leg! Wow. What a moment in this Test, and this series. That simply could not have been closer
outside off, and through to the keeper
uncomfortably onto the front foot, and fenced away with a tangle of limbs
whipped off the toes! It's a boundary, but it's also a bit of a chancy counter-attack to a full and swinging delivery. This is a battle and a half!
a huge cutter from Anderson, pitching leg, jagging like a legbreak. Defended with everything behind the line
back over the wicket and Smith gratefully clips a leg-stump delivery through backward square
nibbling off the seam and through to the keeper
slower ball, wicket to wicket. Defended
angled defence out into the gully, off the back foot
onto the front foot, driven firmly into the gap in the covers
line and length, blocked back whence it came
an elaborate leave as Woakes fires out out wide
outside off, a sighter, no stroke needed
through to the keeper once again
this one nibbles a touch from back of a length, through to the keeper once more, but Handscomb threatened to play at that one
bends back into the right-hander from back of a length. Well bowled, but well blocked
wider line, left alone
pressing onto the front foot, gathered in the covers
back of a length, blocked back to the bowler, standing tall on the back foot

jags off the seam, hits the back pad, and up goes the finger again! Smith reviews again, of course he does, it's tight to off stump, and high on the pad too... but no getting away with it this time! The skipper is gone, and England's fight continues!
immediately edged, down through the cordon! Tough times...
beats the edge with a bit of zing off the deck. Testing times!
tails back in past Lyon's edge this time. He does well to stay inside the line as Bairstow gathers down the leg side
squared up in defence on the back foot
outside off, through to the keeper
tailing into the stumps from wide on the crease. Blocked
attempted leave, but deflected off the face down into the cordon
bouncer, nothing doing there
edged, and down into the cordon! Scenes....
through to the keeper, squeakingly tight to the edge!
outside off, through to the keeper
tailing back in from outside off, and blocked
beautiful seam position, drawing a loose drive, as if mesmerised by the poetry of the approaching orb. Tough times out there!
squared up and squelch! Count them, don't rub them! Delayed reaction from Lyon as he pauses before buckling to the usual sniggers from fielders, crowd and even the physio. Tee hee hee!
left alone to the loudest cheer of a high-octane night
squared up on the back foot, squirted out through point, and that will be stumps
touch short on the body and Lyon flicks a single away through square leg to get off the mark
back of a length, nipping away off the pitch as Handscomb hangs back

short and rearing, there's bite in this, flies off the shoulder of the bat to slip! But Handscomb reviews straight away, he looks pretty confident... and replays quickly show it came off his shoulder rather than the bat. No glove on it either, so that will be decision overturned, good review from Handscomb
fired into the pitch a lot straighter, 133kph and bending to clip the leading edge, turned him round again
pitched up and targeting the stumps, again Handscomb starts to get front on as he closes the bat face and a low leading edge scoots to cover-point
fullish and tapped into the covers coming forwards
in the channel outside off, back of a length and left alone by the nightwatchman
full on middle and off, 130kph and prodded back towards mid-on
pitched up and met with a gentle push towards mid-off
banged in short, flying through at chin height as Lyon levers himself back and out of the way
fullish, 132kph and tapped into the off side
good length outside off, not close enough to the timbers to bring Lyon out of his shell
back of a length, slightly leg side and holding its line, turned away on the back foot
shaping away in the channel, short enough to leave on length
Handscomb jumps back on off stump and defends
full, tempting the drive, Handscomb throws the hands without moving the feet but connects well, cover gets something on it to prevent four
on the stumps and worked to the leg side
fired in straight, 137kph and a hint of swing, well covered off from back in the crease
Lyon mooches across on off stump to defend
pitched up, tempting Lyon forwards outside off and there's enough drift and seam to take the ball zipping past the edge as he goes to drive
holding its line outside off, through to the keeper
pitched up and bunted back to mid-on as he comes across
oh, juicy stuff, pitched up at 137kph and sharking away at the last moment as Lyon aims a booming drive down the ground and is beaten again
good length, 136kph on off stump, clipped along the carpet to mid-on - maiden over from Broad
fullish, played from the crease into the off side
shorter, outside off stump, drops back and taps the ball away again
done him, a Bamber Boozler of a ball, full and swinging away, Handscomb was trying to come forwards but still crease-bound and lucky not to get anything on his drive
comes across and lines this one up in defence
off-stump line, leans into a push
straighter line from Anderson and its nudged away through square leg for a couple

sconed! Dug in short, Lyon jerks his head away - but wears it full on the grill! The blow knocks the stem-guard off, but Lyon manages to stay steady on his feet, even as he nearly steps back on to his stumps. That was a real clanger
short of a length outside off and Lyon rocks back to ramp the ball over the slips and away for four! Back atcha
dug in again, climbing towards the top of the bonce, he jerks out of the way
goes for the stumps, not quite full enough for the yorker... and Lyon continues to go merrily about his way, backing off to slap four through point
ooh, past the edge! Broad puts it on a good length, beats Lyon as he swishes from the crease
on the stumps, where's this gone...?! Swirling leading edge as he shovels to leg but it clears two men in the covers and he'll survive some more
full and driven, now Handscomb is in the runs, nicely steered through the covers although Broad gamely gives chase to prevent four

backing away, chipped in the air and taken at mid-off! The GOAT has been tethered... the adrenaline from that knock to the head probably didn't help, trying to heave over the off side. England get rid of the nightwatchman
touch short on the leg side, worked for one
banged in short as Handscomb creeps underneath it
French cricket from Handscomb, front on as he gets across on off stump and thick-edges a push through point for two
beaten again in the channel, this is another curious innings from Handscomb. But he's still there, much to the irritation of Anderson and England
round the wicket, pitched up on off, nice smooth forward block from Marsh
this curves back a mile, but starting well wide of the stumps and Marsh is able to get a big stride in and leave
foot or so wide of the stumps, left alone
beauty, pretty hard to hit those, 135kph, a touch full and searing past the outside edge, Broad comes down and tells Marsh just how good it was
worked off the stumps to the leg side but Marsh sends his partner back
good-length ball outside off, this time he's able to leave more comfortably - another maiden, England keeping the pressure on
bouncer from Anderson, climbing very high - called wide
length, over the top of off, Handscomb stays still and pushes into the covers
Handscomb seems to have stopped his initial back-leg movement, holds himself upright and drives to cover
woof, past the outside edge again! Leaden-footed drive but he carves out a thick chunk of fresh air

gottim! Handscomb's been on the fritz and the fuse finally blows, another stock-still lunge at he ball and Malan snaffles a superb catch low at third slip! That was about as uncomfortable as watching a hedgehog try to cross the M25
in the channel, holding its line and left alone
comes across on off, again the ball is slightly wide and there's no need to play
Marsh comes across to a fullish ball and defends quietly. He's the key man now
full, comes forward, lets this one go
touch shorter and straighter and flicked away through backward square
over the wicket, good length around off stump, shows it a solid straight bat
fuller, Paine is neatly into line and dabs one short into the leg side, like an office clerk busying himself with the filing
round the wicket, pitched up and blocked into the covers coming forwards
ooh, that's a jaffa, angled in and then spitting past the outside edge as Paine feels for it
good length, fourth-stump line and well judged, no stroke
full, gets him on the front foot, nicely played by Paine, he caresses a drive in front of square and they hustle through for three
angled across outside off stump, 135kph and left alone
length on off, comes forward to defend
pitched up and driven, they pinch one to mid-off... where Mason Crane fuzzes just past the stumps at the non-striker's end with Marsh stretching for his ground
on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler
pushed across the bows, 135kph on a length outside off, lets it go
Marsh continues to apply a soothing flannel to Australia's brow, defended coming across
full on off, chops down on it in defence
length ball on off, again Marsh is happy calmly patting the ball back
left alone in the channel outside off stump
Paine moves across and pushes a length ball square on the off side
slightly back of a length, not so much sideways movement and Paine shows it a straight bat
pitched up, this whispers just enough to take the outside edge as Paine's bat scissors down... but it scoots short of third slip!
there's the lavish outswinger, 134kph and swooshing through to the keeper, bat a long way from connecting as Paine reaches forward
touch wider, comes across and leaves
138kph, pitched up but too straight this time and whipped firmly through midwicket for a couple
starts a fraction short and leg side from over the wicket, punched off the hip for one to Marsh
back of a length, 135kph and climbing off the seam, past the bat as Paine begins to drop his hands
plays back, manages to keep on top of the edge, well grabbed by diving gully on the bounce
dropped down into the covers, there's nearly a mix-up as Marsh is sent back... but Stoneman's throw to the non-striker's end misses and Broad can't get to it backing up, gifting Paine four!
length on the stumps, worked down to the leg side
comes across and lets this one go outside
Anderson going round the wicket to Marsh, tucked to the leg side
continues to hare in, 130kph on a length around off stump, solidly blocked
good length and met on the front foot, blocked into the covers
touch shorter, a foot or two outside off, pushed square on the off side
straighter line, worked away through square leg
full and straightening on off, 137kph, blocked back to the bowler
good length around off stump, Marsh shows it the maker's name
in the channel, teasing line and Marsh comes across, decides to leave late
oof, beaten on the inside, bit of nip back for Woakes as the batsman comes forward. Nods in acknowledgement of a good ball
full on off and he drives, connects this time but without timing
touch short and jabbed away to the leg side
pitched up, 135kph and punched back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through
looped onto a good length from over the wicket, and blocked
outside off, no turn to speak off, but a good pace through the air with a hint of drift. Defended on the back foot
back of a length, turns a touch, cut firmly to a diving Woakes in the gully
a crashing drive, but straight to the sweeper on the cover rope
round the wicket, drawn forward to defend
driven into the covers, attempting to use the feet but squared up by the flight
on the back foot, tight line and length, defended into the off side
a cutter from Woakes, nibbling back into the right-hander, who nudges round the corner
tight line and length again from wide on the crease, punched back to the bowler who threatens to shy as the batsman dives for his crease

top-edged pull, and that's a brilliant take from Overton! That was swirling as it fizzed down to fine leg, but he committed early, despite the presence of square leg in his eyeline, and dived forward well to grab low to the ground. Another excellent display of ticker from the debutant, who's had a quietly impressive allround game
over the wicket to the left-hander, pushed back down the pitch
outside off, no stroke offered
drawn forward to block
poked into the off side
this one bites late and clips the outside edge of the bat, with the pads and stumps very adjacent. Close!
fully forward, pushed back to the bowler
looped up, dips late, tapped to the on-side
back of a length and sliding on, calmly placed back down the pitch
angled defence
on the back foot, blocked into the off side
a skewed drive off a good length, this one flies high over the covers, but plugs just out of reach of the fielder! Frustration for England but they are still brawling
squared up in defence as Woakes finds a probing length once again
leans back and slashes a cut over the head of third slip! Short from Woakes so the shot was on, and he took the chance well
forward and blocked into the covers
a long chase for Bairstow as Starc nibbles one behind square, and the 100 is up
forward and defended
forward once again
tickled around the corner again, there's a man in place this time so Bairstow is spared the chase
leaning onto the front foot to defend
beats the edge, and sharp glovework from Bairstow,  but that back toe was always anchored
outside off, and through to the keeper
short and lifting into the gloves, but outside off. Tapped down to third man
thumped hard and straight, high down the ground! A bit of a mix-up as they turn for the third, but England have dropped the ball so Starc can dive back to his crease
outside edge, gathered in the gully
short and wide of off stump. No stroke offered
cutter from Woakes, his fingers roll on release and Starc is watchful in defence
defended back down the pitch
driven into the covers from a good length
crunched to cover once again
a good-length tweaker, pushed to point
blocked once more
tapped to short cover, and they scamper the single
good leave outside off stump, almost passes over the top of the pegs by the time it's finished swinging
forward and solidly defended to the off side
drilled into the off side
clipped to midwicket and that's a good sharp call. The shy comes in quickly but they are safely home
short and sharp from Woakes. Tight line, and Starc drops his gloves well
cracked hard off the back foot, a stand-and-deliver swing of the blade. Could have gone anywhere, ended up in the boundary boards at third man!
well played, a shimmy down the track at the last minute, and pierces the gap
lifting delivery outside off, and was there an edge on that? Bairstow couldn't gather either way...
width, and cut to third man
back of a length, pokey defence from deep in the crease
bosh! Down on one knee, hooned into the crowd at deep midwicket! That's the way to do it
chopped into the point region, off the back foot
pushed to cover
full length, Marsh aims across the line, and back go his timbers! The wrong shot for a fine delivery, and Woakes has his fourth!
on the back foot, blocked back to the bowler
defended
banged in short, and that gets big on Cummins, right under his armpit
nudged into the leg side
full length, a touch wide, through to the keeper
rolls the fingers, nips through to the keeper as Cummins shoulders arms
up on the toes, pierces the gap in the covers
a massive mow through the line! Misses everything as the ball hops through to the keeper
blocked into the covers, off the back foot

chipped up in the air, Anderson calls for it, dives full stretch, drops it right by the stumps, and Anderson is in pain with a ripped trouser leg! He had the chance in his hands but his momentum slid him into the stumps and the ball out of his grasp. Hopefully he's okay
forward and pushed to cover
onto the front foot, and pushed to the off side
wide on the crease from Woakes, left alone
through to the keeper once more
outside off, swinging away, left alone again
a swish outside off, no contact
on the legs, tucked square
spanked up in the air, Moeen circles at cover, and Anderson has his maiden five-for in Australia! Well bowled old man, he's earned that in every sense. And Australia's innings is all but complete
through to the keeper
banged in short, Cummins ducks
short and lifting into the body, tucked to the leg side
short and ducked again
back of a length, jabbed behind gully with a delicate cut
in the arc, Cummins has a swing, but misses by a mile
popped up in the air on the leg side, Woakes gives chase but can't get close
cracked out to the covers, a good diving stop
short once again and skids through to Bairstow. That was zippy
spanked high and mighty, over the keeper's head! You can't set a field for those. More valuable runs
short, and ducked
tapped into the gap
banged in short, Hazlewood can't reach that one
clever cutter from Anderson, biting the deck and jumping into the gloves
round the wicket, stabbed into the covers for another single
nurdled off the pads, and Australia's lead stretches to 350
tapped into the covers once more
short and through to the keeper
well played, weight hanging back as Woakes comes round the wicket, but the ball comes through the line nicely to punch through the covers
short and jabbed out to point
smacked out to deep cover
round the wicket, back of a length, pops off the pitch, into the splice, Malan dives forward in the gully to wrap up Australia's innings!
angled in from over the wicket, rearing around off as Cook jumps across and blocks
in the channel, good length and 140kph, left alone
short, not getting up that much and Cook pulls, comes off the bottom of the bat and dribbles to square leg
good length but slightly wide of the stumps and Cook leaves it be
touch short outside off, 139kph and prodded towards point playing away from his body
moves across and steers on into the covers to get England up and running
round the wicket, fullish on the stumps and tapped to the on side
pitched up outside off, Cook is a mite slow to pick it up and ends up stunning a drive to mid-off
full and wide, 143kph, decent velocity from the 'slow one', Cook ignores it
good length, 139kph and left alone outside off
comes across and defends down into the covers
draws a bit of a false stroke, seaming in a fraction to clip the inside edge and run to midwicket
pitched up, 142kph a foot or so wide of the stumps, no stroke
good length and decking away as Stoneman edges across and leaves it alone
boing! That's a crackerjack ball, extravagant movement as it swings and darts away, quite a big gap between bat and ball as he pushes forward
beaten again, although he might have just held his bat inside the line as it curved away outside off
tight on off, 140kph and coming in off the pitch this time, blocked firmly into the off side
pitched up and Stoneman has a little flirt, it looked full enough to drive but he wasn't far enough forward and ends up being beaten again

fired in straight and smashing the pads, Hazlewood bellows an appeal! Was it missing leg? Was it high...? Australia mull the review for a long time, but in the end decide not to... Looked very close, and the change of margins on ball-tracking would have made that worth going to DRS, for me
touch short and tucked down into the off side
good length, Cook gets forward on off stump
in the channel outside off and Cook is happy to leave
touch back of a length, tapped down into the covers
full, 139kph a foot or so outside off, plants the front foot and shoulders arms
curling away outside off as Stoneman comes across
full but sliding on to the pads and Stoneman crunches a clip through midwicket to bring him his first runs
back-to-back boundaries, flicked off the legs, in the air but into a gap and it runs away to the rope
three in a row! Stoneman cashes in, wayward from Starc again and this is merrily belted off the pads
short, wide of the stumps and Stoneman drops his hands
and he'll not be in a better mood after this, full on the pads once more and it isn't swinging, Stoneman guides it away for three more to the deep midwicket fence
pitched up and driven, mid-off comes across to prevent any more on the Stoneman ledger
in the channel, he moves across and is comfortable in leaving
good length, 139kph but not coming back in enough to make Stoneman play
fullish on off and prodded back down the track
leans on to the front foot, shoulders arms
spanked! Stoneman now unfurls the cover drive, not the cleanest connection but they get a couple more into the covers
short and rising towards the ribs, Cook tucks it away
dug in but this is a half-tracker, 141kph but sitting up nicely to be hammered on the pull through square leg for his first four
wide of the stumps, back of a length and fading away as Cook leaves
short again, Starc seems to be searching for the right length, a la England in the first innings, wide and ignored
slightly back of a length, 144kph and left alone in the channel
pitched up and this nearly causes mischief as Cook closes the face a touch and gets a leading edge
on the legs, Stoneman waits for it and guides a single behind square - thought about a second but Cook isn't the quickest between the sticks these days
hitting the middle of the pitch but again the ball doesn't get up that high and Cook rasps a pull to the midwicket fence, beyond the dive of Cummins
length on the stumps, calmly nudged to the on side
more runs, pitched up and taking the outside edge as Stoneman presses forward, softly played, perhaps opening the face a touch and it skitters past the slips to the boundary
full and tailing in, 142kph, driven but it comes off the inside half of the bat
full again, there's no swing at the moment and Stoneman just smacks through the line, beats mid-on and it trundles all the way for four more!
round the wicket, this stays very low as Cummins attacks the stumps, just gets his bat down on it
angled in straight, a good-length ball turned to the leg side
in the channel, that's where he caused issues in the first innings, 136kph and left alone
fuller, brings Cook forward, pushed to mid-on off the inside of the bat
slightly short, good carry through outside off, no need to play though
Cook creeps across and taps down square on the off side
flighted, comes across on off stump and blocks
pushed through, slightly wide and Stoneman steers it behind backward point for a couple
defended on the front foot to cover
drops a touch short and Stoneman goes back to slash a cut but picks out the fielder
uses the feet, gets to the pitch and flicks to midwicket
flatter, sliding in and defended on the stumps
ooh, that's a good line, over the wicket now and very close to off stump as Cook shoulders arms
pitched up, 142kph around off, blocked into the covers as he comes across
diligent lines from Cummins, just getting into his stride, defended to the off side
slightly short and veering away as Cook stays in the crease and lets it go
pitched up on off, 143kph and it thuds into the inside edge as Cook reaches forward
on the pads, Cook likes it there and nurdles a single through square
flighted on the stumps, worked away to the leg side

ooh, a ripper! Beats the bat as Cook gropes forward outside off, Paine then whips off the bails and think this might be another good'un, so they'll go upstairs to the third umpire... No, not this time, Cook had his toe grounded, #Wobblyline regardless
comes across and pats it away
oh, skidding on as Cook sweeps, into the front pad... not given! And again Australia elect not to review, looked close but maybe sliding a touch leg side?
yowee! Now this one spits off a length past the outside edge as Cook hangs back!
touch short to finish but Cook doesn't get any reward for a rasping cut shot that finds backward point
round the wicket to Stoneman, back of a length outside off and left alone
136kph on a length, Stoneman comes across and defends this time
still a touch short, lets it fly through
dug in and rising over middle and off, defended towards point
angled in from round the wicket, impressive bounce but again he's able to shoulder arms
short, Stoneman takes the chance to free his arms, slapped past gully and it races away, in the air for a stretch but he struck it well and picks up a sixth boundary
floated up by Lyon and defended on middle and off as Cook comes forward
flatter, goes back and across and taps the ball down square

gives this some air, Cook works across the line, shouts of 'catch!' as it squirms past short leg, there's a moment's hesitation before he scurries away for a single and the safety of the non-striker's end
tossed up and tapped back to the on side
dip and drift, straightening on off, defended
full and flighted, Stoneman defends with a slightly open face. 'Yeeeeeessss, Garry, it's coming, it's coming, boy,' hollers Paine in approval
into the stumps, good length and worked away through the leg side
going on with the arm, Stoneman defends in front of the stumps
pace and carry in the channel but there's little in the way of lateral movement for the Australia quicks so far, no stroke offered
pitched up, 140kph and punched along the carpet to mid-off
hammered in short, this does get up but Stoneman watches it closely and limbos out of the way
angled in full, 139kph, prodded towards cover
'Oh Garry, that is so good...' Tim Paine commentates that one better than I could...
propping forward to defend to the off side
a stern jab down into the off side
slightly shorter, up on the toes, punched to cover
forward and tapped to the leg side
on the back foot, tucked round the corner
back of a length, leg-sided, whipped to deep square leg
round the wicket and ushered through to the keeper
ooh, so close! Outside off, a flat-footed waft, and under-edged past the off stump!
defended on the back foot into the leg side
punched firmly off the back foot into the covers, and that is the fifty stand. Just what England needed to begin their long and unlikely haul
solidly across the stumps, and pushed to the on-side
swept, and doesn't carry to backward square leg! Top-edged, but Hazlewood was slow in setting off, and the half-chance was missed
Cook angles into the gap to return the strike
popped into the leg side, in the air for a moment...
a short ball, Stoneman snatches at it, and under-edges down into the crease, and up into Paine's torso. Feel the paine!
punched out to cover
straightens on a leg-stump line. Another probing over
jabbed off the hip but Marsh dives well at backward square to cut off the runs
outside off, ghosts past the edge as Cook flinches
onto the front foot, meeting the full length delivery with a compact drive
tight line, tight length, blocked
outside off, left alone with a wave of the bat
on the pads, flicked fine for another single
leaning forward to defend
stretching down the line of the pitch, and blocked
punched on the up to cover
forward and defended into the off side

big appeal, and here comes a review. Beats the bat as it slides into the pad, but is it heading down leg? Looks less convincing than the Hazlewood appeal, but no! It's pinning leg stump! Smith has made the right call this time, and England's rock has been detonated!
leg stump, extra bounce into the thigh/midriff. With oodles of close catchers in attendance. Australia have a sniff now
outside off, and left alone with a confident raise of the blade
yikes, that's a brave leave! Hazlewood zings one off the seam and over the top of off by a whisker!
left alone once again as Hazlewood fires one out wide
angled defence into the gully
worked into the leg side
wifty wafty! Hazlewood plugs away with extra bounce outside off, Stoneman aims a flat-footed slap and misses out. Careful Rocky!
solidly onto the front foot, and pushed with confidence back down the pitch
back foot this time, loopy and threatening from Lyon
back onto the stumps, tucked to leg, off the strike
drawing Stoneman forward, no liberties can be taken
probing line and length to the left-hander
nudged into the leg side
banging away outside off, no flashy drive from Vince just yet
dangling the carrot outside off stump. Vince shoulders arms once more
squared up on leg stump, and blocked
outside off once again, Vince is biding his time, and rightly so. The last thing England need to do is rush to their target. If they are still batting tomorrow evening, they will have won
forward and head over the ball to block
defended to cover
nice shape from Starc
slides into the pad, still hints of swing with the slightly aging ball

in the air and gone! Stoneman's weight was back on his heels as he pushed uncertainly outside off, and Khawaja at gully scoops a fine low chance! A tame end to another fighting knock, but Starc's threat got the better of him
outside off, shape through the air, left alone
on the pads, flicked to fine leg
solidly onto the front foot, and blocked back down the pitch
left alone with a yawning leave
angled into the right-hander from wide on the crease
rising delivery on a middle-and-off line. Root squeezes a push into the leg side
through to the keeper once more, a consistently wide line to Vince. It's as if Australia think he likes the flashy drive
short and that's a proper bouncer! Zeroing in from a tight line, but Vince hauled his neck out of harm's way, watching the ball all the way. Proper cricket!
there's the drive! But fair play to Vince, he picked his ball immaculately - a fraction over-pitched, swinging under his eyeline, and pumped with confidence through the covers. Well played
outside off, swinging away, through to the keeper
probing away on a tight line to the right-hander
props forward to block to cover with a loud 'no!'
short and Root sways inside the line. Cramped for room by the left-arm line
solidly steered off the back foot to point
driven, not entirely in control as Starc angles across his bows, but he gets plenty bat on it in the end, and slices his drive through backward point for a boundary
sharp turn, into the right hander, lots of noise around the bat
fully forward to block
propping forward, immaculate length
no way through, as three men lurk round the bat
cautiously pushed out to cover
stabbed down into the crease to see off another over
poking forward into the off side
drilled with an open face out to point, but Lyon dives well to cut off the runs. Wasn't far shy of carrying to him, either
open-faced poke out to point, tough going out there now
on the back foot, pushed to cover
comfortably driven out to deep cover. One ball of the session to go
wicket to wicket, attacking the leg stump. Blocked to complete a gripping session
round the wicket to Vince, tossed up on middle and off, leans on to a forward defensive
touch short down the leg side, Vince was thinking about playing and then allowed it to hit him on the thigh, they trot one but are sent back by the umpires without a leg bye scored
flatter on the stumps and defended from the crease
flighted, nudged away on leg stump
tossed up, slightly leg side again and Vince this time works one behind square for a single
pushed through on the off stump and Root pinches one with a dab into the covers followed by a Scrappy Doo scramble
short, rising outside off, Root fences and gets an edge, the ball flew wide of third slip and I think he just opened the face to keep it down, picks up four
full and straight, 141kph and whipped off the pads, couple more through midwicket, Root already ticking
slightly full of a length and shaping in as Vince presses forward with a thou-shalt-not-pass forward defensive
angled across on the full, 142kph but he gets across well and splats a drive through cover, well chased down in front of the rope by Warner but they pick up three more
length ball, veering away like a pink comet in the channel, no stroke
Root moves across and flicks off his hips for another run to finish a productive over
flighted, outside off and gripping a touch as Root attempts to drive and it clips the inside edge
skips forward to a full ball and prods one into the covers, rotating the strike again
flatter, defended on the back foot in front of off stump
tossed up, Vince drops deep in the crease and blocks again
quicker and straighter and Vince nearly steers it to leg slip, just gets a tickle and it runs fine for one
floated up full on leg stump, Root looks busy and clips one more through midwicket
pitched up, Root eases on to the front foot and plays a high-elbow drive, sends it straight to mid-off
slanted across, testing length, he's neither back nor forward but manages to prod it away
full on off, 141kph and drilled through the covers coming forward for two more, into the 20s now
dug in, the ball going away outside off but Root manages to control the pull and gets one to deep square
pitched up, encouraging the drive again and Vince accedes, sends it low to point
good line, 142kph an inch or two outside off, Vince judges it well and shoulders arms
spinning in, cries of 'catch!' as the ball hits the inside edge but falls to earth
tries to come down but only manages to squirt the ball to mid-on
ooh, excitement around the bat, don't think it carried to Warner at leg slip... Came off the thigh pad, too
plays back on leg stump and this time he does get some bat on it, an low edge squeezed past Warner as he went in the other direction
Vince plays a solid-looking forward defensive
tossed up on the stumps and worked away
left alone in the channel as he moves across
short and rising outside off, Root dabs it down and they sprint one, despite Warner swooping in from cover
short and sliding across towards the slips as Vince weaves out of the way
touch short, steered down towards gully with an angled bat
139kph on a length, comes across and plays the line well, defended

pitched up and nicked off! Vince is a goner... A familiar tale of briefly attractive (or should that be attractively brief) accumulation, before a loose stroke gives it away. This Australia attack don't need gifts, but they'll gladly accept them
tossed up and spinning in, worked down to the leg side
on the stumps and tapped away
comes across and keeps the ball out, to grunts of interest around the bat
floated up on middle and off, Root shows it a straight bat
shuffles down and clips one off his toes through the midwicket area
ooh, starts well to another lefty, fizzing through into the gloves as Malan pokes off the back foot. Survives
pinged for four! Cummins round the wicket, full outside off and crunched through the covers coming gracefully forwards, lovely stuff
on the stumps and worked away
pitched up and driven, Cummins grabs it in his left paw
comes across and taps the ball away
fullish, entices the drive again, Root isn't quite in line and an inside edge pops short into the leg side
oof, ripsnorting bumper to finish the over! Root does a marionette dance but manages to get out of the way
pushed through outside off and Malan swats it away through point off the back foot
sliding down the leg side, Paine appeals for a catch behind but Lyon isn't interested
leg-stump line, playing back and jabbed down short of the catching me
tossed up and worked to leg
drops short, Root latches on and swings a firm pull away to deep square leg, into the gap for four - and that's the England 100 up

plays no shot on the back foot, this doesn't spin as much, hits the pad - and given out! Root quickly goes to the DRS, though, as height looked a question... and sure enough, Hawk-Eye has it going over the stumps! Root gets the benefit of the review system this time, to the delight of a small-but-barmy section of the crowd!
in the channel outside off, Malan comes across
closer to the off stump, Malan lines this one up and defends
oh, past the bat, drawing him forward and then nipping it away, but nothing on it
comes across to defend on off stump
probing line, 142kph and Malan can't get forward to it, manages to jab the ball away square
fired in straight, this is testing stuff but Malan gets it away to the leg side
floated up on the stumps, Root comes across and taps it away
drags this down, leg side and paddled away for a single to deep backward square
straightening outside off, Malan judges it well and leaves
floated full, bit of drift in and worked to leg
gives it some air, spinning sharply away on off stump, again he goes back and leaves - well judged
uses the feet and pushes into a gap in the covers for one
short and rising in the corridor outside off stump, Malan leans back out of the way
banged in, too short and Malan can again move across to shoulder arms
Cummins is very disciplined in exploring this channel outside off, wide enough to leave though
speared in on off now, 144kph but blocked towards point
gets into line on off and again defends down square
fuller, 142kph and worked into the leg side - maiden over, Cummins keeping the pressure on
Root releases the shackles with a sweep, gets well forward and rolls the wrists, flashed to deep square leg
comes forward and looks for one into the covers, not there
tossed up on off, some turn but Root plays it softly and blocks
on to the front foot and tapped down again
floated up, Root gets a good stride and shows it the bat face
pushed through a little flatter and Root drops on to off stump to defend
short in the channel and Malan is happy to let these go wherever he can
comes across and dabs the ball down square
shortish, climbing through to Paine as he goes back and across and shoulders his piece
full and drifting on to the pads, Malan glances through backward square for a single to get off strike
defended into the ground, for a moment there's a danger of it rebounding towards the stumps and Root whirls bodily to guard his wicket

wow, this explodes off a length, straight through Root and Paine leaps for a magnificent catch to his left... Did Root get an inside edge on this? Australia think so and review but the evidence suggests it just flicked the top of the pad flap. They check for lbw as well but it's going well over off stump, so they lose a review, too
trundles through and puts it in the channel, no stroke

nip-backer, slamming into the pads, is Malan gone now? Dar shakes his head but again Australia decide to review, the height is the question once more - and Hawk-Eye says it's missing! Hit above the knee roll and bouncing over middle, despite Malan being quite far back
comes across and this time gets bat on it in defence
touch short, around off stump, patted down square
plugging away outside off, maybe setting up for another inswinger, left alone
full on the pads and whipped away but midwicket is there to cut it off
pitched up, good pace but Root chops down on it
good length, rising sharply outside off stump, left alone
targets the front pad, they got him out twice like this at the Gabba, Root brings his bat down on it
moves across on off and leaves a good-length delivery
around off stump, 141kph, defended with an open face towards backward point
tight lines and again met with a front-foot block into the covers by Root
comes across to a length ball outside off
Hazlewood fires it in straight and Malan clamps down on it in defence
sliding on to the pads, turned around the corner - maybe off the pad - and it runs fine to the boundary
pitched up and driven coming forwards, taken on the bounce at mid-off - causing half of the (possibly squiffy) crowd to cheer for a catch
good throat ball from Hazlewood, 138kph but Malan plays it well, swaying back out of the way
full but straying on to the pads and it's clipped through square for one more
pitched up and given a royal spanking through cover, lovely flowing drive from Malan, undoing his top button and allowing a bit of chest hair to show
yeow, smashed on the wrist! Dug in, nasty short ball, it's coming at Malan all the way and he can't get out of the line, ends up wearing the blow... Maybe the glove took the impact but he seems okay
back of a length, defended down from back on off stump
touch short and defended down off the inside edge, short leg sweeps up
angled across in the corridor, left alone

gah, that's a Street Fighter uppercut of a delivery! Flying at the face, 141kph and somehow Malan manages to get his gloves up and ride it! Well bowled and well played - just a shrug and a look, stoic stuff
length in the channel, 135kph and ignored
overpitched on middle and leg, easy pickings for most right-handers and it's pinged away through square leg for four
goes full and straight again but this is off line, 139kph but he just uses the pace on the ball and eases it to the rope
