fullish length outside off, draws Root into the drive but he sends it to cover point
touch short and defended on the back foot
banged in short and Root rocks on to his haunches
oh, lovely bowling, that's zinged away as Malan begins to follow it, maybe just short enough to give him time to adjust
back of a length, 144kph as Cummins brings the heat, stabbed down towards backward point
dug in, Malan hops across and jams the ball into his body, deflects away safely in front of the wicket
length ball, sliding across in the channel outside off, no stroke
short ball, rising like steam, only 136kph but it was going away from Malan who elected at the last moment to pull out of a cross-batted swipe
banged in short and he pre-emptively ducks the challenge this time
round the wicket, looped onto a good length
not a whole lot of a shot going on here, but beats the keeper without flicking the pad. Effective
dropped! Perfect from Lyon, turn, bounce, thick outside edge, low to Smith's right at slip, but he can't cling on!
fully into line to defend
shorter, slapped urgently to point, but can't get the angle into the shot
blocked once more, as another probing but luckless over comes to an end
up on the toes, stabbed with a straight bat to point
full toss, swinging into the pads. A rare freebie for Malan who flicks through the leg side
plugging away from over the wicket
back of a length, Root hops across his stumps to defend
back cut, and that's a lovely strike to bring up Root's fifty - his second of the series, and potentially even more crucial than his first was threatening to be.
on the back foot, defended down into the crease
forward and defended into the off side
outside off, turning sharply, Malan looks to glide through third man
cut hard, wide line. Aggressive intent
outside off, turning sharply, takes the inside-edge and pops up, just out of the reach of Bancroft, who made great ground at short leg but couldn't get there!
squared up on the walk as Malan defends
sharp intent from Malan, advancing to the pitch, and stealing a well-judged single to a deep-set mid-on. A few more singles would help England's - and Root's - cause
opens the face and slashes handsomely through backward point!
yikes, inside-edge and that eludes the top of the bails and the wicketkeeper! So close, so lucky! But they all count!
more solidly into line, on the back foot, punched to point
flicked out to deep midwicket, more runs to the cause
glided out to backward point

short, pulled, nailed! Bissects the two men at square leg perfectly, so perfectly in fact that they clash together at the ball zips through, like the heavily closing doors of the London Overground. Mind the gap!
sharp spin again, but Root works with the turn and nudges behind square

round the wicket, and that's a confident manipulation, down on one knee to sweep behind square. England are in a zone at the moment, and Australia are feeling the pinch for the first time this evening
tucked to the leg side
cracked hard off the back foot, but straight to backward point
good areas Garry. Leg-stump line, straightening on pitching and blocked
advancing to the pitch, but Lyon saw him coming and hauled back his length. Defended in the end but the intent is plain!
solidly into line to defend
round the wicket, angled into off stump, met with a solid straight bat
attacking line from round the wicket, Root tightens up in defence
driven into the off side
defended into the gully. Root working with the angle
solid drive to mid-off. England are brawling into the sunset!
back of a length, and that deflects in a completely weird direction through gully. Off the toe-end maybe? Not entirely in control...
tapped to leg
worked back down the pitch
arm-ball from Lyon, huge appeal but Australia have no reviews! That beat Malan on the back leg, but there's no recourse either way, and the Barmy Army are giving it plenty. It was Umpire's Call!
pushed to cover
worked around the corner. Too many scenes!
sprayed down the leg-side
up on the toes, poked down to third man
right behind the line to defend
very full length, in the blockhole, drilled back to the bowler
square driven, lots of intent, good fielding from Lyon at deep point
full length from over the wicket, patted back to the bowler
round the wicket, speared in a touch flatter, flicked to leg
solidly onto the front foot, and pushed to cover
back of a length, pulled with resolve out to deep midwicket
outside off, cut firmly to deep cover
hits the pads! But clearly pitched outside leg this time, as Root elects to leave well alone. Looked alarming, but no danger that time
tickled fine
good delivery, tight to off stump, angling in, targetting that perceived weakness of Root's to the lbw. But he's equal to it this time
he's got it going! Cummins zips this one in late from outside off. Root gives himself a talking-to after clipping a touch flightily across the line...
this is a tight over from Cummins, on and around off stump. Root needs to be watchful
crashed through the covers! In the air for a while, but eludes short cover - in fact, that was technically a drop! So close to the bat though
huge appeal, but there's an inside edge on that one! Cummins is making the ball talk and Root is living dangerously in this over
driven hard into the covers again! Root survives a very probing over. And the requirement dips once more...
on the pads, tucked behind square.
outside off, a rare sighter, as Malan leaves alone with unusual lack of drama
tighter line, lifting off the deck, poked out to point
outside off, tapped to gully
left alone outside off
opens the face to glide another nurdle to gully.
outside off, that's a good delivery, zipping off the deck through to the keeper. Root flirts as it goes by, but avoids committing
left alone with a raise of the bat and a hop across the crease for good measure
through to the keeper once more. Root is drawing the sting in this over, as Cummins slips to a back-of-a-length approach
fierce from Cummins! Root has no choice but to ride the bounce and glove that into the leg side. He kept it down well, but a reminder of the enduring threat in these juicy conditions

round the wicket, and bowled! Tremendous from Cummins, holds its line to ping back the top of off, straight through Malan's defences, and look at the reaction! Australia are utterly pumped, they've prised an opening, any opening, and now there's a tough 20 minutes for a new batsman.
attempted yorker! Welcome to the crease. Inswinging at 90mph, and tapped back whence it came. Don't breathe just yet!
driven hard to cover
full and attacking from Hazlewood, pushing Root back onto the stumps
banged in short, that's a tremendous delivery and Root sways out of the way
tickled into the gap to rotate the strike
solidly into line on off stump
good delivery, tailing into the stumps, and watchfully blocked on off stump
attacking the top of off, tapped out to cover
tight line and length, no way through
perfect from Cummins, wider on the crease, angled into the stumps, beats the edge of bat and stumps! So close!
solidly forward, blocked into the off side
yorker! Zeroes in on Woakes' toe, and somehow skews off the toe of the bat, and away past gully! That is incredibly good, and incredibly well played!
on the legs, clipped through the leg side, and England have given themselves a fighting chance!
fullish, around off stump and Woakes presses forward to defend calmly

zipping through, perfect line delivery, is that caught behind... yes, given! Woakes looks very doubtful and quickly reviews, it's close to the edge, no deviation... and no Hot Spot. But Snicko picks up a thin sound! The Barmy Army cheers quickly fall silent, as they realise this isn't going to be overturned. What a start for Australia, a wicket off the second ball!
over the wicket, good length around off, Moeen defends
ooh, that's teasing, in the channel and Moeen tries to withdraw his bat, deflects it down towards slip
back of a length, 139kph and Moeen covers the line, dabs down square
touch back of a length, good pace and carry but it's wide enough for Moeen to ignore
round the wicket, speared in on off stump and defended down into the track
some shape for the old ball here, 142kph and fading away from Root as he comes across and leaves
ooh, leading edge, lands short of point! Pitched up and holding its line, Root nearly getting into trouble trying to close the face
full and angled in, blocked towards mid-off
pitched up, 141kph a foot or two outside off, Root shoulders arms
pitched up, that's the line but Root watches it closely and bunts into the off side - another maiden
short outside off, 140kph and met with the face of the bat on the back foot
length, gets him driving, Moeen drives and thick-edges through the leg side for one... first run of the day and England are halfway there (and living on a prayer, yodel the Barmy Army in the stands)
touch short in the channel, rising sharply as Root gets his gear out of the way
shortish, 139kph as the ball begins to drift in a touch, punched down into the off side in circumspect fashion

length and holding its line, another beauty of a ball and Root is gone! Is that the game...? He was slightly late on it and the pink just scratched the cue end, Australia knew, Aleem Dar knew and Root must have done, too. Hazlewood has picked up this game and smashed it on a rock!
climbing through outside off, 148kph, serious heat on this as he throws up the hands
over the wicket to Moeen, in the channel and defended coming forwards
Moeen moves across and has a bit of a swish, clipped through the leg side for one
round the wicket, fullish and driven without timing coming forwards
boshed through the covers, first boundary of the afternoon! Committed stroke from YJB, leaning into a crisp drive
back of a length, 143kph and defended on the back foot around off stump
fired in on the stumps, he covers any reverse and pushes towards cover
slanted across in the channel outside off stump and left well alone
tighter to the stumps, back of a length and defended to the on side
excellent line, that is less charitable than your average bailiff, Moeen shoulders arms
short and prodded square from back in the crease, point is slightly deep but they won't chance it
short of a length and driven off the back foot, in the air for a bit but it bobbles safely to the fielder... Hazlewood throws his hands up and hides a smile
pitched up and encouraging the drive, struck to mid-off without much timing
pushed across Bairstow's bows from over the wicket, he leaves it be
probing away, Starc just keeping this tight for now, but there's always menace... left again
pitched up, 141kph and draws the drive, picks out cover
rearing off a length, crashes into the outside edge - but falls short of the slips! It scoots away for four, too
fired in straight, pushed back down the track
touch short, 136kph and swatted through the covers off the back foot, there's a sweeper out and they trot the single
nippy, this comes in at YJB, who chops down on it late
angled in towards the stums, worked to the leg side
length ball on middle stump, blocked back towards the bowler
yowch, that's a stinger on the hip for Bairstow, jagging in at him as he stabs hurriedly at the ball and is beaten on the inside
pitched up and crunched into the off side, extra cover snaffles it on the bounce
short outside off and Bairstow cuts behind square, they're kept to one by good work in the field by Lyon
good pace, back of a length outside off as YJB draws his bat inside the line
comes across and leaves a slightly short ball in the channel
ooh, that's a ripper, back of a length and seaming, swinging late as Bairstow is beaten on the back foot
fuller, presses on to the front foot and pushes to cover
short on the stumps, 139kph and Bairstow works it away to midwicket
comes across and turns a back-of-a-length ball into the leg side - good start from Cummins, maiden over, keeping the boot down
round the wicket, tossed up and straightening outside off, defended
pushed through, bit of grip as Moeen leans out and taps it away
spinning off a length as Moeen goes back and blocks
beaten past the outside edge, ragging through as Moeen tries to get forward, into the gloves (but this time the back foot is grounded behind the line as Paine removes the bails)
flighted, goes back and punches into the covers

tossed up, Moeen goes to sweep and is hit on the front pad... Up goes the finger! Australia are cock-a-hoop but Moeen delays their gratification by reviewing; this is going to be close but the margins are in Lyon's favour here. Sure enough, it's just in line (umpire's call) and just clipping the top of off (umpire's call) - and England are truly in the soup!
short and turned off the body into the leg side
short outside off, Bairstow has a slash and fails to connect
length on the pads, 140kph and whipped away to deep square leg
targeting the stumps, Overton thrusts his front leg forwards and blocks doughtily
steered down into the off side
shortish and chopped down towards cover point from the crease
touch short and pulled away off the back foot for another single
flighted, straightening on the stumps, Overton defends
floated up on off stump and blocked coming forward again
goes back on the stumps and flicks a single through square leg to get off the mark
pushed through outside off, Bairstow raps a cut to the man set back at cover
gets this into a gap coming forwards and they get a couple
jaffa from Cummins! Pitched up at 141kph and then high-kicking past the outside edge as Overton reaches for it
gets across and presses forward to defend
pitched up and pushed along the carpet to mid-on
digs in the bouncer, rapid but rising well over the crouching Overton
good length, 141kph on the speed gun and edged for four! The ball didn't quite carry, third slip was diving across but wasn't able to get a hand to it
banged in short and Overton misjudges the ball, wears it fully on the chest! He's down on his knees and looks in some pain here
tucked off the pads to the leg side
leaning forward to defend
head right over the ball, sniffing the leather
pushed cautiously forward to defend once again
sharp turn from outside off, but Overton rides the bounce well to dump the ball on the leg side
over the wicket and pressed back down the pitch. Comfortably played
on the back foot, squared up by extra lift
rare width and firmly cracked to the point boundary's edge. Bairstow wanted two but slipped on turning. He's so quick that he'd have easily made it
edged, but a controlled edge. Gully gathers on the bounce

edged and dropped! A low edge to third slip, it carried comfortably, but Bancroft snatched at it, it hit the heels of his hands and into the turf. He's actually at a sort of kamikaze silly slip, with a lid on as well, a good two metres closer than the rest of the cordon
banged in short, and Overton ducks
outside off, and through to the keeper with a loose poke
tucked into the leg side. The 200 is up!
stretching forward to defend once more
outside off, threatening to turn, met with a firm block on the front foot
turning from outside off, Overton hangs on the back foot to tuck it to leg
faster and flatter, again Overton favours the back foot as he defends with the spin
stretching forward this time. Solid
a confident front-foot punch down to long-off. And good decisive running from Overton to turn back for two
outside off, cracked firmly on the up and into the covers
sharp through the air
defended high on the bat as Cummins' extra pace comes to the party
edged again, but bounces short of gully! Cummins' extra pace lured Overton into a rather rash waft, attempting to steer the ball down, but it was a catching-practice sort of shot
firmly blocked, right behind the line
flipped off the hip, leg slip is lurking, as 'catch it!' is the cry. But no bat this time
leaning forward, firmly driven, meeting the flight well
chiselled into the leg side, another single chipped off the target
tweaked into the pads, turned to the leg side
tossed up, and flicked firmly down the ground, past Lyon's right hand and gathered at long-on
on the pads, worked square to chalk off another over. Only 70-odd left to see out the draw!
tapped to cover, an instant run, and Warner gathers quickly but the shy deflects off Overton's bat as he makes his ground!
banged in short, through to the keeper
width, and steered into the off side with a waft of willow
outside off
on the back foot, and defended back down the pitch
bouncer, and ducked

first ball inswinger, thuds into the pad, and Starc strikes! Wow, who needs a sighter? Just perfect line and curling length from over the wicket. Overton had no answer as he propped forward hopefully but merely made his pad into target practice. England's challenge is all but cooked!
beaten outside off stump, another outswinger but curls past the edge
steps across the stumps to flick high and hopefully over the leg side
full and threatening, with late in-dip. Bairstow keeps his head over the ball to guide a defensive push back down the pitch
driven down the ground, a rare and well snaffled boundary. Nothing wrong with the delivery, just solid connection on the front foot
banged in short, and left well alone
late swing from a full length, squeezed off the inside edge into the pads, and so nearly wriggles onto the stumps!
down the leg side, beats everything with late swing. A rare bonus to England's faltering cause!
on the legs, clipped sweetly into space at deep midwicket. Runs are flowing!
flicked off the legs, in the air for a while, but safe enough
a big booming outswinger. Bairstow has a mow, and well, why shouldn't he? But that misses everything
inswinger, good change from Hazlewood, but the ball is off-line. A rare feast of English runs in that over
such a full length, and Broad somehow gets the thinnest splinter of the corner of his toe-end to save his pads from a brutally comprehensive lbw!
on the pads again, slightly shorter this time. Broad hops onto the back foot, always anticipating the bouncer, and flicks the ball fine
on the back foot once more. Blocked with a bunny hop down into the crease

full, fast and straight, but Broad's inelegant hopping is just about keeping it out in this over. It's French cricket, essentially. A vertical bat, right back on the stumps, blocking for his life. His heel finished about 4cm from the stumps on that occasion as the ball squirted through gully
back and across once more. Hang in there, Broady
outside off, full length, a thin edge, a low catch to the keeper. A valiant but sorry stay from a batsman who is a shadow of his former self
through to the keeper with good lift and hostility
angled into the stumps, and blocked to the off side
tailing in from outside off, Bairstow block-drives back to the bowler
nibble off the seam, beats the outside edge. Well bowled again
spanked through the covers. Hazlewood overpitches and Bairstow gives it some welly. Not dead yet!
short and outside off, Bairstow swats inelegantly through the leg side. A bit top-edged, but the ball lands safely between the in- and out-fielders. That'll do
utterly smoked through the covers! Where was Jonny when England still had a hope? He's got to move up the order at Perth, surely
and that is the end of that! Tighter line, back of a length, cramped for room, and inside-edged into middle stump!
